analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca

The celestial Rishi Narada, the son of Brahma, who was dear to the gods,

analyzed: tasmāt sa kāśyapasya atha dvitīyaḥ mānasaḥ bhavat

analyzed: tatas bhisaṃdhim cakre vai dakṣaḥ ca parameṣṭhinā

analyzed: brahmajit kratujit ca eva devāntaka narāntakau

analyzed: kālanemi sutāḥ hi ete śabhoḥ tu śṛṇuta prajāḥ

analyzed: rājājaḥ ca eva gomaḥ ca śaṃbhoḥ putrau prakīrttitau
translated: Raja and Goman are declared to be the sons of Shambhu.

analyzed: virojanasya putraḥ ca baliḥ ekaḥ pratāpavān
translated: And Viraja's son was the powerful Bali alone.

analyzed: baleḥ putra śatam jajñe rājānaḥ sarve eva te

analyzed: teṣām pradhānāḥ catvāraḥ vikrāntāḥ su mahā balāḥ

analyzed: sahasrabāhuḥ śreṣṭhaḥ bhūdbāṇaḥ rājā pratāpavān
translated: The best of them was Sahasrabahu, and the powerful king Bana,

analyzed: kuṃbhagarttaḥ dayaḥ bhojaḥ kuñciḥ iti evamāḥ dayaḥ

analyzed: śakunī pūtanā ca eva kanye dve tu baleḥ smṛte

analyzed: baleḥ putrāḥ ca pautrāḥ ca sahasraśas

analyzed: bāleyāḥ nāma vikhyātāḥ gaṇāḥ vikrānta pauruṣāḥ
translated: The groups known as Balieyas, of valorous prowess, were famous.

analyzed: bāṇasya ca aindradhanvā tu lohinyām udapadyata
translated: And Indradhanu was born to Bana from Lohini.

analyzed: ditiḥ vihita putrā vai toṣayāmāsa kaśyapam

analyzed: tām kaśyapaḥ prasanna ātmā samyak ārādhitaḥ tu atha
translated: Kashyapa, pleased with her proper worship,

original: vareṇa chandayāmāsa sā ca vavre varaṃ tata // / / //
analyzed: vareṇa chandayāmāsa sā ca vavre varam tata
translated: was delighted to grant her a boon. She then asked for a boon.

analyzed: atha tasyai varam prādāt prārthitaḥ bhagavān punar

original: ukte vare tu mā tuṣṭā ditistaṃ samabhāṣata // / / //
analyzed: ukte vare tu mā tuṣṭā ditiḥ tam samabhāṣata
translated: But Diti, not satisfied with the boon offered, spoke to him,

analyzed: mārīcam kaṇyapam devī bharttāram prāñjaliḥ tadā
translated: with folded hands, the goddess Diti spoke to her husband Maricha, Kashyapa.

analyzed: hata putrā asmi bhagavan ādityaiḥ tava sūnubhiḥ
translated: O Lord, I have been deprived of my sons by your sons, the Adityas.

analyzed: śakra hantāram icchami putram dīrghatapaḥ ūrjitam

analyzed: sā aham tapaḥ cariṣyāmi garbham ādhātum arhasi
translated: I shall therefore perform austerities. You should impregnate me.

original: putramindravadhe yuktaṃ tvaṃ mai vai dātumarhasi /

translated: You should not give me a son who is destined to kill Indra.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tat vacanam śrutvā mārīcaḥ kaśyapaḥ tadā
translated: Hearing her words, Maricha Kashyapa,

analyzed: pratyuvāca mahā tejāḥ ditim parama duḥkhitaḥ
translated: the greatly radiant one, replied to Diti, who was extremely distressed.

original: evaṃ bhavatu garbhe tu śucirbhava tapodhane // / / //
analyzed: evam bhavatu garbhe tu śuciḥ bhava tapodhane
translated: Let it be so. O ascetic, be pure in your womb.

analyzed: janayiṣyasi putram tvam śakra hantāram āhave
translated: You will give birth to a son who will kill Shakra in battle.

analyzed: pūrṇam varṣa sahasram tu śuciḥ yadi bhaviṣyasi
translated: If you remain pure for a full thousand years,

analyzed: putram triloka pravaram manmatham janayiṣyasi
translated: you will give birth to a son, the foremost in the three worlds, who will be Manmatha (Kama).

analyzed: evam uktvā mahā tejāḥ tathā samabhāvat tadā
translated: Having said this, the greatly radiant one became silent.

analyzed: tām ālabhya sva bhavanam jagāma bhagavān ṛṣiḥ
translated: The illustrious sage, having embraced her, went to his own abode.

original: gate bharttari sā devī ditiḥ paramaharṣitā // / / //
analyzed: gate bharttari sā devī ditiḥ parama harṣitā
translated: When her husband had left, that goddess Diti, greatly delighted,

analyzed: kuśaplavanam āsādya tapaḥ tepe su dāruṇam
translated: reached Kushaplavana and performed severe austerities.

analyzed: śakraḥ tu samupaśrutya saṃvādam tam tayoḥ prabhuḥ
translated: Shakra, the lord, having heard that conversation between the two,

translated: approached Diti at Kushaplavana and spoke these words:

analyzed: śuśrūṣām te kariṣyāmi mā anujñām dātum arhasi
translated: I will serve you. You should grant me permission.

analyzed: samidhaḥ ca āhariṣyāmi puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca

analyzed: yathā tvam manyase vatsa suśrūṣā abhirataḥ bhava

analyzed: sarva karmasu niṣṇātaḥ ātmanaḥ hitam ācara
translated: Skilled in all actions, do what is good for yourself.

original: varaṃ śrutvā tu ta dvākyaṃ mātuḥ śakraḥ praharṣitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: varam śrutvā tu mātuḥ śakraḥ praharṣitaḥ
translated: Having heard those words of his mother, Shakra, delighted,

analyzed: śuśrūṣā abhirataḥ bhūtvā kaluṣeṇa antarātmanā
translated: Devoted to service, with a tainted mind,

analyzed: śuśrūṣate tu tām śakraḥ sarvakālam anuvrataḥ
translated: Always served her, being devoted to her.

analyzed: phala puṣpāṇi upādāya samidhaḥ ca dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: Bringing fruits, flowers, and fuel, firm in his vows,

original: gātrasaṃvāhanaṃ kāle śramāpanayane tathā // / / //🔽śakraḥ sarveṣu kāleṣu ditiṃ paricacāra ha /
analyzed: gātra saṃvāhanam kāle śrama apanayane tathā  śakraḥ sarveṣu kāleṣu ditim paricacāra ha
translated: And massaging her body in time to relieve fatigue,🔽Shakra served Diti at all times.

original: kiñcicchiṣṭe vrate devī tuṣṭā śakramuvāca ha // / / //
analyzed: kiñcid śiṣṭe vrate devī tuṣṭā śakram uvāca ha
translated: When a little of the vow remained, the satisfied goddess Diti said to Shakra,

analyzed: pratītā aham te suraśreṣṭha daśa varṣāṇi putraka
translated: I am pleased with you, O best of gods, O son. Ten years remain.

original: avaśiṣṭhāni bhadraṃ te bhrātaraṃ drakṣyase tataḥ // / / //🔽tamahaṃ tvatkṛte putra saha dhāsye jayaiṣiṇam /

translated: May you fare well. You will then see your brother.🔽For your sake, O son, I shall nourish him, O conqueror.

original: trailokyavijayaṃ putra bhokṣyase saha tena vai // / / //
analyzed: trailokya vijayam putra bhokṣyase saha tena vai
translated: With him, O son, you will enjoy the conquest of the three worlds.

analyzed: na aham putra abhijānāmi mad bhakti gata mānasam
translated: I do not know of any one else who has such devotion to me as you have.

original: evamuktvā ditiḥ śakraṃ madhyaṃ prāpte divākare // / / //🔽nidrayāpahṛtā davī śiraḥ kṛtvā tu jānuni /

translated: Having said this to Shakra, Diti, when the sun had reached the middle (of the sky),🔽went to sleep, placing her head on her knees,

analyzed: keśān kṛtvā tu pāda sthān sā suṣvāpa ca devatā
translated: and placing her hair on her feet, that goddess slept.

analyzed: adhastāt yat tu nābheḥ vai sarvam tat aśuci smṛtam
translated: Whatever is below the navel is considered impure.

analyzed: tatas tām aśucim jñātvā saḥ uṃtaram tat amanyata
translated: Then, knowing her to be impure, he considered that to be an opportunity.

original: dṛṣṭvā tu kāraṇaṃ sarvaṃ tasya buddhirajāyata /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tu kāraṇam sarvam tasya buddhiḥ ajāyata
translated: Having seen the entire reason, his mind arose,

original: garbhaṃ nihantu vai devyā sa hi doṣo 'tra dṛśyate // / / //
analyzed: garbham nihantu vai devyā sa hi doṣaḥ dṛśyate
translated: thinking, I will kill the embryo of the goddess. That fault is seen here.

original: tato viveśa dityā vai hyupasthenodaraṃ vṛṣā /
analyzed: tatas viveśa dityāḥ vai hi upasthena udaram vṛṣā
translated: Then the bull entered Diti's womb through her vagina.

original: praviśya cāpi taṃ dṛṣṭvā gabhamindro mahaujasam // / / //
analyzed: praviśya ca api tam dṛṣṭvā gabham indraḥ mahā ojasam
translated: Having entered and seen that embryo of great power, Indra,

analyzed: bhītaḥ tam saptadhā bibheda ripum ātmanaḥ
translated: fearing it, split the enemy of himself into seven parts.

analyzed: garbhaḥ bhidyamānaḥ tu vajraṇa śata parvaṇā
translated: The embryo, being split by the thunderbolt with a hundred joints,

original: ruroda susvaraṃ bhīmaṃ vepamānaḥ punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: ruroda su svaram bhīmam vepamānaḥ punar punar
translated: cried out in a loud and terrible voice, trembling again and again.

analyzed: māroda mārodaḥ iti garbham śakraḥ bhyabhāṣata
translated: Shakra said to the embryo, Do not cry, do not cry.

original: taṃ garbhaṃ saptadhā kṛtvā hyekaikaṃ saptadhā punaḥ /
analyzed: tam garbham saptadhā kṛtvā hi ekaikam saptadhā punar
translated: Indra then divided that embryo into seven parts, and each of those seven parts into seven again.

analyzed: kuliśena bibheda indraḥ tatas ditiḥ abudhyatā
translated: And Indra then split them with his thunderbolt. Then Diti awoke.

original: na hantavyo na hantavya ityevaṃ ditirabravīt /
analyzed: na hantavyaḥ na hantavyaḥ iti evam ditiḥ abravīt
translated: And she said, He should not be killed, he should not be killed!

original: niṣpapāta tato vajrī māturvacanagauravāt // / / //🔽prāñjalirvajrasahito ditiṃ śakro 'bhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: niṣpapāta tatas vajrī mātuḥ vacana gauravāt  prāñjaliḥ vajra sahitaḥ ditim śakraḥ bhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the wielder of the thunderbolt, out of respect for his mother's words, came out.

analyzed: aśuciḥ devi suptā asi pādayoḥ gata mūrddhajā  tadam taram anuprāpya garbham hetāram āhave

analyzed: bhinnavān aham etam te bahudhā kṣantum arhasi
translated: You should forgive me for that.

analyzed: tasmin tu viphale garbhe ditiḥ parama duḥkhitā
translated: But when that embryo was destroyed, Diti was extremely sorrowful.

analyzed: sahasrākṣam durādharṣam vākyam sa anunayā bravīt
translated: She spoke to the invincible thousand-eyed one with gentle words:

analyzed: mama aparādhāt garbhaḥ yam yadi te viphalīkṛtaḥ
translated: If this embryo of mine has been rendered fruitless by you because of my fault,

analyzed: na aparādhaḥ sti deveśa tava putra mahā bala
translated: O lord of gods, O son of great strength, you are not at fault.

original: śatrorvadhe na doṣo 'sti bhetavyaṃ na ca te vibho /
analyzed: śatroḥ vadhe na doṣaḥ sti bhetavyam na ca te vibho
translated: There is no sin in killing an enemy, O lord, you need not fear.

analyzed: priyam tu kṛtam icchāmi śreyaḥ garbhasya me kutas
translated: But I desire that which is pleasing to me, what good can come of this embryo?

analyzed: bhavantu mama putrāṇām sapta sthānāni vai divi
translated: Let there be seven regions in heaven for my sons.

analyzed: vātaskandhān imān sapta carantu mama putrakāḥ
translated: Let my sons move in these seven currents of wind.

analyzed: marutaḥ te tu vikhyātāḥ gatāḥ te saptasaptakāḥ
translated: Those Maruts, known as the seven times seven, have gone.

analyzed: pṛthivyām prathama skandhaḥ dvitīyaḥ ca api bhāskare
translated: The first current is on earth, the second in the sun,

analyzed: some tṛtīyaḥ vijñeyaḥ caturthaḥ jyotiṣām gaṇe
translated: The third should be known in the moon, the fourth in the group of luminaries,

analyzed: graheṣu pañcamaḥ ca eva ṣaṣṭhaḥ saptarṣi maṇḍale
translated: The fifth in the planets, the sixth in the circle of the seven sages,

analyzed: dhruve tu saptamaḥ ca eva vātaskandhāḥ ca sapta ye
translated: And the seventh in the pole star, those are the seven currents of wind.

analyzed: tān ete vicarantu adya kāle kāle mama ātmajāḥ
translated: Let my sons move in those at different times.

analyzed: vātaskandha adhipāḥ bhūtvā carantu mama putrakāḥ
translated: Let my sons move as lords of the currents of wind.

original: pṛthivyāṃ prathamaskandha ā meghebyo ya āvahaḥ // / / //
analyzed: pṛthivyām prathama skandhe ā meghebyaḥ yaḥ āvahaḥ
translated: The first current on earth is the one that brings rain from the clouds.

original: carantu mama putrāste sapta ye prathame gaṇe /
analyzed: carantu mama putrāḥ te sapta ye prathame gaṇe
translated: Let my sons, the seven in the first group, move in that.

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ ca api meghebhyaḥ āsūryāt pravahaḥ tatas
translated: The second is the one that moves from the clouds to the sun.

analyzed: vātaskandhaḥ hi vijñeyaḥ dvitīyaḥ caratām gaṇaḥ
translated: That current of wind should be known as the second moving group.

analyzed: sūryāt ūrdhvam adhas somāt udvahaḥ sa vai smṛtaḥ
translated: The one above the sun and below the moon is then known as the upward moving one.

analyzed: vātaskandhaḥ tṛtīyaḥ ca putrāṇām caratā gaṇaḥ
translated: The third is the Vata Skandha, the group of my sons who move about.

analyzed: somāt ūrddhvam adha ṛkṣebhyaḥ caturtha saṃvahaḥ tu saḥ
translated: Above Soma and the lunar mansions, the fourth is the Samvaha wind.

analyzed: caturthaḥ mama putrāṇām gaṇaḥ tu caratām vibho
translated: The fourth group of my sons who move about, O Lord,

analyzed: ṛkṣebhyaḥ ca tathā evā ūrddhvamā grahāt vivahaḥ tu yaḥ
translated: is the one that moves above the lunar mansions and below the planets.

analyzed: vātaskandhaḥ pañcamaḥ tu putrāṇām caratām gaṇaḥ
translated: The fifth is the Vata Skandha, the group of my sons who move about.

analyzed: grahebhyaḥ ūrddhvam ārṣibhyaḥ ṣaṣṭhaḥ hi anuvahaḥ ca yaḥ
translated: The sixth is the Anuvaha wind that moves above the planets and below the sages.

analyzed: vātaskandhaḥ tatra mama purāṇām caratā gaṇaḥ
translated: The Vata Skandha there is the group of my ancient sons who move about.

original: ṛṣibhya ūrddhvamādhrauvaṃ saptamo yaḥ prakīrttitaḥ // / / //🔽vātaskandhaḥ parivahastatra tiṣṭhantu me sutāḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣibhyaḥ ūrddhvam ādhrauvam saptamaḥ yaḥ prakīrttitaḥ  vātaskandhaḥ parivahaḥ tatra tiṣṭhantu me sutāḥ
translated: The seventh is proclaimed as the one that moves above the sages and below the stars.🔽The Vata Skandha is the Parivaha wind, where my sons reside.

analyzed: etān sarvāḥ carantu ante kāle kāle mama ātmajāḥ
translated: Let all these move about at different times, my sons.

analyzed: tvad kṛtena ca nāmnā vai bhavatu marutaḥ tu ime
translated: And let these Maruts be named after you.

analyzed: tatas teṣām tu nāmāni mad putrāṇām śatakrato
translated: Then, O Shatakratu, know the names of my sons

analyzed: tadvidhaiḥ karmabhiḥ ca eva samavehi pṛthak pṛthak
translated: and their separate activities.

analyzed: śakrajyotiḥ tathā satyaḥ satyajyotiḥ tathā aparaḥ
translated: Shakrajyoti, Satya, Satya-jyoti, and another,

analyzed: citrajyotiḥ ca jyotiṣmān sutapaḥ caityaḥ eva ca
translated: Chitrajyoti, Jyotishman, Sutapas, and Chaitya,

analyzed: sutamitraḥ hi amitraḥ ca suramitraḥ tathā aparaḥ
translated: Sutamitra, Amitra, and Suramitra,

analyzed: gaṇaḥ eṣa dvitīyaḥ tu tṛtīyam ca nibodhata
translated: This is the second group. Understand the third.

analyzed: dhātuḥ ca dhanadaḥ ca eva hi ugraḥ bhīmaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Dhatu, Dhanada, Ugra, and Bhima,

analyzed: varuṇaḥ ca tṛtīyam ca mayā proktam nibodhata
translated: Varuna, and the third, as told by me, understand.

analyzed: abhiyuktākṣikaḥ ca eva sāhvāyaḥ ca gaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Abhiyuktaksha and Sahavaya are remembered as a group.

analyzed: īdṛś ca eva tathā anyādṛś sa marit druma vṛcakṣakāḥ
translated: Such and other, equal, tree-eyed,

analyzed: mitaḥ ca samitaḥ ca eva pañcamaḥ ca tathā gaṇaḥ
translated: Mitra, Samita, and the fifth group,

analyzed: īdṛś ca puruṣaḥ ca eva na anyādṛś sama cetanaḥ
translated: Such, and Purusha, not other, equal, intelligent,

original: saṃmitaḥ samavṛttiśca pratihartā ca ṣaḍ gaṇāḥ // / / //
analyzed: saṃmitaḥ sama vṛttiḥ ca pratihartā ca ṣaṭ gaṇāḥ
translated: Sammita, Samavritti, and Pratiharta, the six groups.

analyzed: yajñaiḥ citvā astuvan sarve tathā anye mānuṣāḥ viśaḥ
translated: Having performed sacrifices, all of them praised, and also other human clans,

analyzed: daitya devāḥ samākhyātāḥ saptā ete saptasaptakāḥ
translated: These seven groups of seven are known as the Daityas and Devas.

analyzed: ete hi ekonapañcāśat marutaḥ nāmataḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: These forty-nine are known by the name Maruts.

original: prasaṃkhyātāstadā tābhyāṃ dityā śakreṇa caiva vai // / / //
analyzed: prasaṃkhyātāḥ tadā tābhyām dityā śakreṇa ca eva vai
translated: They were thus enumerated by Diti and Shakra.

analyzed: kṛtvā ca etāni nāmāni ditiḥ indram uvāca ha
translated: Having given them these names, Diti spoke to Indra,

analyzed: vātaskandhān carantu ete bhrataraḥ mama putrakāḥ
translated: Let these brothers, my sons, move in the wind-currents.

original: vicarantu ca bhadraṃ te devaiḥ saha mamātmajāḥ /
analyzed: vicarantu ca bhadram te devaiḥ saha mama ātmajāḥ
translated: May my sons move with the gods, for your good.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tat vacanam śrutvā mahasrākṣaḥ purandaraḥ
translated: Hearing her words, the thousand-eyed Purandara,

analyzed: uvāca prāñjaliḥ bhūtvā mātar bhavatu tat tathā

analyzed: sarva m etat yathā uktam te bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ

translated: Thus will these great-souled princes, honored by the world,

analyzed: devaiḥ saha bhaviṣyanti yajña bhājaḥ tava ātma jāḥ

analyzed: deva gandharva mukhyānām putrāḥ te vai sukhe ratāḥ

analyzed: dhārmikāḥ ca vara utsiktāḥ yuddha śaiṇḍāḥ mahā balāḥ

analyzed: mita bhāṣāḥ kṣamāvantaḥ hi ācāra pariniṣṭhitāḥ

analyzed: ke vai te pitaraḥ nāma yeṣām menā tu mānasī
translated: Who are those Pitṛs of whom Menā is the mental daughter?

original: mainākaścaiva dohitro dauhitrī ca tathā hyumā /
analyzed: mainākaḥ ca eva dohitraḥ dauhitrī ca tathā hi umā
translated: And Maināka is the grandson, and Umā is the granddaughter,

analyzed: ekaparṇā tathā ca eva tathā ca eva ekapāṭalā
translated: and Ekaparṇā, and also Ekapatralā,

original: gaṅgā cāpi saricchreṣṭhā sarvāsāṃ pūrvajā tathā /
analyzed: gaṅgā ca api sarit śreṣṭhā sarvāsām pūrvajā tathā
translated: and Gaṅgā, the best of rivers, who is the eldest of all.

analyzed: sarvam etat tvayā uddiṣṭam nirdeśam tasya naḥ vada
translated: You have mentioned all this, now tell us the explanation of it.

original: śrotumicchāmi bhadraṃ te śrāddhasya ca vidhiṃ param /
analyzed: śrotum icchāmi bhadram te śrāddhasya ca vidhim param
translated: For your welfare, we wish to hear the supreme injunctions of Śrāddha.

original: putrāśca ke smṛtāsteṣāṃ kathaṃ ca pitarastu te // / / //
analyzed: putrāḥ ca ke smṛtāḥ teṣām katham ca pitaraḥ tu te
translated: Who are remembered as their sons, and how are they the Pitṛs?

original: kathaṃ vā te samutpannāḥ kiṃnā mānaḥ kimātmakāḥ /
analyzed: katham vā te samutpannāḥ kiṃnā mānaḥ kimātmakāḥ
translated: How were they born? What is their measure? What is their nature?

original: svarge vai pitaro hyete devānāmapi devatāḥ // / / //
analyzed: svarge vai pitaraḥ hi ete devānām api devatāḥ
translated: These manes are in heaven, they are the deities even of the gods.

analyzed: evam veditum icchāmi pitṝṇām sargam uttamam ā
translated: Thus I desire to know the excellent creation of the manes.

original: yathā ca dattamasmābhiḥ sārddhaṃ prīṇāti vai pitṝn // / / //
analyzed: yathā ca dattam asmābhiḥ sārddham prīṇāti vai pitṝn
translated: And how do they delight the manes together with us when offered?

original: yadarthaṃ te na dṛśyante tatra kiṃ kāraṇaṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: yad artham te na dṛśyante tatra kim kāraṇam smṛtam
translated: For what reason is it remembered that they are not seen there?

original: svarge tu ke ca varttante pitaro narake va ke // / / //
analyzed: svarge tu ke ca varttante pitaraḥ narake ke
translated: Who are the manes in heaven, and who are in hell?

analyzed: abhisaṃbhāṣya pitaram pituḥ ca pitaram tathā
translated: Having addressed the father, and then the father's father,

original: pratitāmahaṃ tathā caiva triṣu piṇḍeṣu nāmataḥ // / / //
analyzed: pratitāmaham tathā ca eva triṣu piṇḍeṣu nāmataḥ
translated: and the great-grandfather, in the three balls of rice, by name.

original: nāmnā dattāni śrāddhāni kathaṃ gacchanti vai pitṝn /
analyzed: nāmnā dattāni śrāddhāni katham gacchanti vai pitṝn
translated: How do the Śrāddhas offered by name reach the manes?

original: kathaṃ ca śaktāste dātuṃ narakasthāḥ phalaṃ punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: katham ca śaktāḥ te dātum naraka sthāḥ phalam punar
translated: And how are they able to give the fruit again, being in hell?

original: ke ca te pitaro nāma kānyajāmo vayaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: ke ca te pitaraḥ nāma kāni ajāmaḥ vayam punar
translated: Who are those manes, and whom do we offer again?

original: devā api pitṝn svarge yajantīti hi naḥ śrutam // / / //
analyzed: devāḥ api pitṝn svarge yajanti iti hi naḥ śrutam
translated: We have heard that even the gods worship the manes in heaven.

analyzed: etat icchāmi vai śrotum vistareṇa bahu śrutam
translated: I desire to hear this in detail, O you who have heard much.

analyzed: spaṣṭa abhidhānam api vai tat bhavān vaktum arhasi
translated: You should clearly explain that to us.

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

analyzed: atra vaḥ kīrtayiṣyāmi yathāprajñam yathāśrutam
translated: In this regard, I will narrate to you as I have understood and heard,

analyzed: manvantareṣu jāyante pitaraḥ deva sūnavaḥ
translated: The Pitris, the sons of gods, are born in the Manvantaras.

analyzed: atīta anāgatāḥ śreṣṭhāḥ kaniṣṭhāḥ kramaśas tu vai
translated: The past and future ones are the best, and the younger ones are in order.

analyzed: devaiḥ sārddham purā atītāḥ pitaraḥ vai
translated: In the other Manvantaras, the Pitris are different from the gods in the past.

original: vartante sāṃprataṃ ce tu tānvai pakṣyāmi niścayāt /
analyzed: vartante sāṃpratam ce tu tān vai pakṣyāmi niścayāt
translated: I will certainly describe those who are present now.

analyzed: śrāddha kriyām manuḥ ca eṣām śrāddhadevaḥ pravarttayet
translated: Manu, the god of Shraddha, will perform the Shraddha rites for them.

original: devānsṛjata brahmā māṃ yakṣyantīti ca prabhuḥ /
analyzed: devān sṛjata brahmā mām yakṣyanti iti ca prabhuḥ
translated: When Brahma, the lord, created the gods, he did so thinking they would worship him.

analyzed: tam utsṛjya tadā ātmānam ayajan te phala arthinaḥ
translated: But they abandoned him and worshipped for the sake of fruits.

original: te śaptā brahmaṇā mūḍhā naṣṭasaṃjñā bhaviṣyatha /
analyzed: te śaptāḥ brahmaṇā mūḍhāḥ naṣṭa saṃjñāḥ bhaviṣyatha
translated: They were cursed by Brahma, You will become deluded and lose your consciousness.

analyzed: tasmāt kiñcid na jānīta tatas lokeṣu muhyata
translated: Therefore, you will know nothing and will be confused in the worlds.

original: te bhūyaḥ praṇatāḥ sarve yācanti sma pitāmaham /
analyzed: te bhūyas praṇatāḥ sarve yācanti sma pitāmaham
translated: Then they all bowed down and requested the grandfather again.

analyzed: anugrahāya lokānām punar tān abravīt prabhuḥ
translated: The lord again spoke to them for the benefit of the worlds.

original: prāyaścittaṃ caradhvaṃ vai vyabhicāro hi vaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: prāyaścittam caradhvam vai vyabhicāraḥ hi vaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Do you perform expiation, for you have committed a sin.

analyzed: putrān svān paripṛcchadhvam tatas jñānam avāpsyatha
translated: Do you ask your own sons, and then you will obtain knowledge.🔽Then, desirous of expiation, they asked their own sons,

original: tatasta svasutāṃścaiva prayaścittaji ghṛkṣavaḥ /🔽apṛcchansaṃyatātmāno vidhivacca mitho mithaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas te sva sutān ca eva prayaścitta ji  apṛcchan saṃyata ātmānaḥ vidhivat ca mithas mithas
translated: and those self-controlled ones asked each other in due order.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ te niyata ātmānaḥ putrāḥ śaṃsuḥ anekadhā
translated: Those self-controlled sons told them in various ways,

analyzed: prayaścittāni dharma jña vāc manaḥ karma jāni ca
translated: the expiations for sins committed by speech, mind and body, O you who know Dharma.

analyzed: te putrān abruvan prītāḥ labdha saṃjñāḥ divaukasaḥ
translated: Then those dwellers of heaven, having regained consciousness, joyfully said to their sons:

analyzed: yūyam vai pitaraḥ smākam yaiḥ vayam pratibodhitāḥ
translated: You are our fathers, by whom we have been awakened.

original: dharmaṃ jñānaṃ ca vairāgyaṃ ko varo vaḥ pradīyatām /
analyzed: dharmam jñānam ca vairāgyam kaḥ varaḥ vaḥ pradīyatām
translated: Do you give us the boon of Dharma, knowledge and detachment.

analyzed: pustān abravīt brahmā yūyam vai satya vādinaḥ
translated: Brahma said to them, You are truthful speakers.

analyzed: tasmāt yat uktam yuṣmābhiḥ tat tathā na tat anyathā
translated: Therefore, what has been said by you is so, not otherwise.

original: uktaṃ ca pitaro 'smākaṃ ceti vai tanayāḥ svakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: uktam ca pitaraḥ smākam ca iti vai tanayāḥ svakāḥ
translated: And it has been said by our own sons, 'You are our fathers.'

analyzed: pitaraḥ te bhaviṣyanti tebhyaḥ yam dīyatām varaḥ
translated: To them, the gods said, They will be your fathers. Let this boon be given to them.

original: tenaiva vacasā te vai brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tena eva vacasā te vai brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ
translated: By that very word of Brahmā, the supreme lord,

analyzed: putrāḥ pitṛ tvam ājagmuḥ putra tvam pitaraḥ punar
translated: The sons became fathers and the fathers became sons again.

original: tasmātte pitaraḥ putrāḥ pitṛtvaṃ teṣu tatsmṛtam // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt te pitaraḥ putrāḥ pitṛ tvam teṣu tat smṛtam
translated: Therefore, they are fathers to the sons and that fatherhood is remembered in them.

analyzed: evam smṛtvā pitṝn putrāḥ putrān ca eva pitṝn tathā
translated: Thus remembering the ancestors as sons and the sons as ancestors,

analyzed: vyājahāra punar brahmā vitṝn ātma vivṛddhaye
translated: Brahmā again spoke for the growth of the ancestors.

analyzed: yaḥ hi a niṣṭān pitṝn śrāddhi kriyām kāñcid akariṣyati
translated: Whoever performs any Śrāddha rite for the ancestors,

original: rākṣasā dānavāśbaiva phalaṃ prāpsyanti tasya tat // / / //
analyzed: rākṣasāḥ dānavāḥ ba eva phalam prāpsyanti tasya tat
translated: The demons and Dānavas will obtain the fruit of that.

analyzed: śrāddhaiḥ āpyāyitāḥ ca eva pitaraḥ somam avyayam
translated: The ancestors, being gratified by Śrāddhas, will gratify the imperishable Soma,

analyzed: āpyāyamānāḥ yuṣmābhiḥ varddhayiṣyanti nityaśas
translated: And being gratified by you, they will always increase.

analyzed: śrāddhaiḥ āpyāyitaḥ somaḥ lokān āpyāyayiṣyati
translated: Soma, being gratified by Śrāddhas, will gratify the worlds,

analyzed: kṛtsnam sa parvata vanam jaṅgama ajaṅgamaiḥ vṛtam
translated: Along with the mountains, forests, and the moving and unmoving.

analyzed: śrāddhāni puṣṭi kāmāḥ ca ye kariṣyanti mānavāḥ
translated: Those men who will perform Śrāddhas desiring nourishment,

original: tebhyaḥ puṣṭiṃ prajāścaiva dāsyanti pitaraḥ sadā // / / //
analyzed: tebhyaḥ puṣṭim prajāḥ ca eva dāsyanti pitaraḥ sadā
translated: The ancestors will always grant them nourishment and offspring.

analyzed: śrāddhe yebhyaḥ pradāsyanti trīn piṇḍān nāma gotrataḥ
translated: Those to whom the three funeral cakes will be offered at the Sraddha, with their names and families,

analyzed: sarvatra vartamānāḥ te pitaraḥ prapitāmahāḥ
translated: The Pitris and the great-grandfathers of all,

analyzed: teṣām āpyāyayiṣyanti śrāddha dānena vai prajāḥ
translated: Will be gratified by the offerings made at the Sraddha.

analyzed: evam ājñā kṛtā pūrvam brahmaṇā parameṣṭhinā
translated: This command was given in days of yore by Brahman, the lord of all creatures.

analyzed: tena etat sarvathā siddham dānam adhyayanam tapaḥ
translated: Therefore, gifts, study of the Vedas, and penances, are all well-known.

analyzed: te tu jñāna pradātāraḥ pitaraḥ vaḥ na saṃśayaḥ  iti ete pitaraḥ devāḥ devāḥ ca pitaraḥ punar
translated: They are the givers of knowledge. They are your Pitris. There is no doubt in this.🔽These are the Pitris and the gods. The gods are again the Pitris.

analyzed: anyonya pitaraḥ hi ete devāḥ ca pitaraḥ ca ha
translated: They are the Pitris of one another. They are both gods and Pitris.

analyzed: etat brahma vacaḥ śrutvā sūtasya vidita ātmanaḥ
translated: Having heard these words of Brahman from Suta of purified soul,

analyzed: papracchuḥ munayaḥ bhūyas sūtam tasmāt yat uttaram
translated: The Rishis again asked Suta this question.

analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The Rishis said:

analyzed: kiyantaḥ vai muni gaṇāḥ kasmin kāle ca te gaṇāḥ
translated: How many are the classes of Munis? In what age did they originate?

analyzed: pūrve tu deva pravarāḥ devānām soma varddhanāḥ
translated: The gods who are the foremost of the gods, who are the increasers of Soma,

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

analyzed: etat vaḥ ham pravakṣyāmi pitṛ sargam anuttamam
translated: I shall now describe to you the excellent creation of the Pitris.

original: śaṃyuḥ papraccha yatpūrvaṃ pitaraṃ vai bṛhaspatim // / / //

translated: which Shamyu asked his father Brihaspati in the past.

analyzed: bṛhaspatim upāsīnam sarva jñāna artha kovidam
translated: To Brihaspati, who was seated, skilled in all knowledge and meaning,

analyzed: samudbhūtāḥ katham ca ete pitṛ tvam samupāgatāḥ

analyzed: vairājāḥ iti vikhyātā devānām divi devatā
translated: The gods in heaven are known as the famous Vairajas.

analyzed: yogena tapasā yuktaḥ pūrvam eva tadā prabhuḥ

analyzed: ādidevāḥ iti khyātāḥ mahā sattvāḥ mahā ojasaḥ

analyzed: māyā viharaṇe vipra girau kraiñce nipātite
translated: O Brahmin, when Maya was carried away and thrown down on the Kraincha mountain,

analyzed: tārake ca asura vare samudīrṇe nipātite
translated: and when Taraka, the best of demons, was slain,

analyzed: sa iṃdra upendraiḥ mahābhāgaiḥ devaiḥ agni sutaḥ prabhuḥ
translated: the powerful son of Agni, the lord, was consecrated by the great-souled gods, with Indra and Upendra,

analyzed: senāpatyena daityāriḥ abhiṣiktaḥ pratāpavān  deva senāpatiḥ tu eṣa paṭhyate sura nāyakaḥ
translated: as the general of the army, the enemy of the demons.🔽He is called the general of the gods, the leader of the gods.
He is Skanda, the destroyer of the enemies of the gods, the lord, the master of all worlds.

analyzed: pramathaiḥ vidhaiḥ devaḥ tathā bhūta gaṇaiḥ api
translated: And by the Pramathas, various kinds of gods, and also by the hosts of Bhutas,

analyzed: mātṛbhiḥ vividhābhiḥ ca vināyaka gaṇaiḥ tatas
translated: And then by the various Mothers, and by the hosts of Vinayakas,

original: lokāḥ somapadā nāma marīceryatra vai sutāḥ // / / //
analyzed: lokāḥ somapadāḥ nāma marīceḥ yatra vai sutāḥ
translated: The worlds are named Somapada, where the sons of Marichi are,

analyzed: tatra te divi varttante devāḥ tān pūjayanti uta
translated: There they exist in heaven, and the gods worship them.

original: śrutā barhiṣado nāma pitaraḥ somapāstu te // / / //🔽eteṣāṃ mānasī kanyā acchodā nāma nimnagā /
analyzed: śrutāḥ barhiṣadaḥ nāma pitaraḥ soma pāḥ tu te  eteṣām mānasī kanyā acchodā nāma nimnagā
translated: The Pitris named Barhishads have been heard of by you, who are drinkers of Soma.🔽The mental daughter of these, named Achchhoda, is a river.

analyzed: acchaudam nāma tat divyam saraḥ yasmāt samutthitā
translated: That divine lake named Achchhoda, from which she has arisen,

analyzed: tathā na dṛṣṭa pūrvā astu vitaraḥ te kadācana
translated: And such distributors have never been seen by you before.

analyzed: saṃbhūtā mānasī teṣām pitṝn svān na abhijānatī
translated: She, born from the mind, not recognizing her own Pitris,

original: sā tvanyaṃ pitaraṃ vavre tānatikramya vai pitṝn /🔽amāvasumiti khyātamailaputraṃ nabhaścaram // / / //
analyzed: sā tu anyam pitaram vavre tān atikramya vai pitṝn  amāvasum iti khyātam ailaputram nabhaḥ caram
translated: She chose another Pitri, transgressing those Pitris.🔽Known as Amavasu, the son of Aila, who moves in the sky,

analyzed: adrikā apsarasā yuktam vimāna dhiṣṭhitam divi
translated: United with the Apsara Adrika, seated in a celestial vehicle in the sky.

analyzed: sā tena vyabhicāreṇa gagane na a prajāriṇī
translated: She, by that transgression, did not shine in the sky,

analyzed: pitaram prārthayitvā anyam yoga bhraṣṭā papāta ha
translated: Having chosen another Pitri, fallen from Yoga, she fell.

analyzed: trīṇi avaśya dvimānāni patantī sā divaḥ cyutā
translated: And those three inevitable aerial cars, she, fallen from heaven,

analyzed: trasareṇu pramāṇāni teṣu ca avasthitān pitṝn
translated: And the manes dwelling in them, of the size of a triśaṅku,

analyzed: su sūkṣmān aparivyaktān agnīn agniṣu iva āhitān  trāyadhvam iti uvāca ārtā patatī ca api avākśirāḥ
translated: Very subtle, not manifest, like fires offered into other fires,🔽She, distressed, said, Save me! and fell with her head downwards.

original: tairukā sā tu mā bhaiṣī rityato 'dhiṣṭhitābhavat // / / //🔽tataḥ prasādayatsā vai sīdantī tvanayā girā /
analyzed: taiḥ ukā sā tu mā bhaiṣīḥ riti atas dhiṣṭhitā abhavat  tatas prasādayat sā vai sīdantī tu anayā girā
translated: Do not be afraid, they said, and she was supported by them.🔽Then, sinking, she propitiated them with these words.

analyzed: ūcuḥ te pitaraḥ kanyām bhraṣṭa aiśvaryām vyatikramāt
translated: Those manes, due to her transgression, spoke to the maiden whose prosperity had declined:

analyzed: bhraṣṭa aiśvaryām sva doṣeṇa patasi tvam śuci smite
translated: O you of pure smiles, you are falling due to your own faults, having lost your prosperity.

analyzed: yaiḥ ācaranti karmaṇi śarīraiḥ iha devatāḥ
translated: By which bodies the deities perform the rite here,

original: taireva tatkarmabhalaṃ prāpnuvanti sadā sma ha /
analyzed: taiḥ eva tad karma bhalam prāpnuvanti sadā sma ha
translated: By those very bodies they always obtain the fruit of that rite.

original: sadyaḥ phalanti karmāṇi devatve pretya mānuṣe // / / //
analyzed: sadyas phalanti karmāṇi deva tve pretya mānuṣe
translated: The rites bear fruit immediately in the case of gods, and after death in the case of humans.

analyzed: tasmāt sva tapasaḥ putri pretya saṃprāpsyase phalam
translated: Therefore, O daughter, you will obtain the fruit after death by your own austerity.

original: ityuktayā tu pitaraḥ punaste tu prasāditāḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti uktayā tu pitaraḥ punar te tu prasāditāḥ
translated: Thus addressed, she again propitiated those manes.

analyzed: dhyātvā prasādam te cakruḥ tasyāḥ tat anukaṃpayā
translated: Having meditated, they, out of compassion for her, bestowed grace upon her.

original: avaśyaṃ bhāvinaṃ dṛṣṭvā hyarthamūcustadā tu tām // / / //
analyzed: avaśyam bhāvinam dṛṣṭvā hi artham ūcuḥ tadā tu tām
translated: Beholding the inevitable future, they then spoke to her.

analyzed: soma pāḥ pitaraḥ kanyām tvam amāvasoḥ
translated: You are the daughter of the Soma-drinking Pitris, of this very king, of the illustrious Avasu.

analyzed: utpannasya pṛthivyām tu mānuṣeṣu mahātmanaḥ
translated: When he is born on earth among men, you will be his daughter.

original: kanyā bhūtvā tvimāṃllokānpunaḥ prāpsyasi bhāmini /🔽aṣṭāviṃśe bhavitrī tvaṃ dvāpare matsyayonijā // / / //
analyzed: kanyā bhūtvā tu imān lokān punar prāpsyasi bhāmini  aṣṭāviṃśe bhavitrī tvam dvāpare matsya yoni jā
translated: Having become a maiden, you will again attain these worlds, O beautiful one.

analyzed: asya eva rājñaḥ duhitā hi adrikāyām amāvasoḥ
translated: In the twenty-eighth Dwapara, you will be born as a fish, and again as the daughter of this very king, of Adrika, of the illustrious Avasu.

analyzed: parāśarasya dāyādam ṛṣim tvam janayiṣyasi
translated: You will give birth to a sage who will be the son of Parashara.

original: sa vedamekaṃ brahmarṣi ścaturddhā vibhajiṣyati /🔽mahābhiṣasya putrau dvau śantanoḥ kīrttivarddhanau // / / //
analyzed: sa vedam ekam brahmarṣiḥ ścaturddhā vibhajiṣyati  mahābhiṣasya putrau dvau śantanoḥ kīrtti varddhanau
translated: That great sage will divide the one Veda into four parts.

analyzed: vicitravīryam dharma jñam tvam eva utpādayiṣyasi
translated: You will give birth to the two sons of Mahashalashva, who will increase the fame of Shantanu, and to Vichitravirya, who is learned in the ways of dharma.

original: citrāṅgadaṃ ca rājānaṃ sarvasattvabalānvitam // / / //🔽etānutpādayitvātha punarlokānavā psyasi /
analyzed: citrāṅgadam ca rājānam sarva sattva bala anvitam  etān utpādayitvā atha punar lokān avā psyasi
translated: You will also give birth to the king Chitrangada, who will be endowed with the strength of all beings.🔽Having given birth to these, you will again attain the worlds.

analyzed: vyabhicārāt pitṝṇām tvam prāpsyase janma kutsitam
translated: But due to your transgression against the Pitris, you will obtain a despised birth.

analyzed: tasya eva rājñaḥ tvam kanyā adrikāyām bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will be the daughter of that very king, of Adrika.

analyzed: kanyā bhūtvā tatas ca tvam imān lokān avāpsyasi
translated: And then, becoming a maiden, you will attain these worlds.

original: evamukatvā tu dāśeyī jātā satyavatī tu sā /
analyzed: tu dāśeyī jātā satyavatī tu sā
translated: Having thus spoken, she became the daughter of a fisherman, that Satvatī.

original: adrikāyāḥ sutā matsyā sutā jātā hyamāvasoḥ // / / //
analyzed: adrikāyāḥ sutāḥ matsyā sutāḥ jātāḥ hi amāvasoḥ
translated: The daughter of Adirā, born from a fish, was born as the daughter of Āmavasu.

analyzed: adikā matsya saṃbhūtāḥ gaṅgā yamunā saṃgame
translated: Born from Adirā and a fish, at the confluence of the Ganges and Yamunā,

original: tasyā rājño hi sā kanyā rājño vīryeṇa caiva hi // / / //
analyzed: tasyāḥ rājñaḥ hi sā kanyā rājñaḥ vīryeṇa ca eva hi
translated: That maiden of the king, and also by the power of the king,

original: virajānāma te lokā divi rocanti te gaṇāḥ /
analyzed: virajānāma te lokāḥ divi rocanti te gaṇāḥ
translated: Those worlds named Virajā shine in heaven, those groups.

original: agniṣvāttāḥ smṛtāstatra pitaro bhāskaraprabhāḥ pulahasya prajāpateḥ /
analyzed: agniṣvāttāḥ smṛtāḥ tatra pitaraḥ bhāskara prabhāḥ pulahasya prajāpateḥ
translated: The ancestors are remembered there as Agniṣvāttas, having the radiance of the sun, of the patriarch Pulaha.

original: eteṣāṃ mānasī kanyā pīvarī nāma viśrutā // / / //
analyzed: eteṣām mānasī kanyā pīvarī nāma viśrutā
translated: The mental daughter of these, known as Pīvarī,

original: yoginī yogapatnī ca yogamātā tathaiva ca /
analyzed: yoginī yogapatnī ca yogamātā tathā eva ca
translated: Is also a yoginī, the wife of a yogin, and the mother of yoga.

analyzed: bhavitā dvāparam prāpya aṣṭāviṃśatim eva tu
translated: She will be born in the twenty-eighth Dvāpara age.

analyzed: śrīmān vyāsaḥ mahā yogī yogaḥ tasmin dvijottamāḥ
translated: The glorious Vyāsa, the great yogi, O best of Brahmins, the yoga,

analyzed: vyāsāt araṇyām saṃbhūtaḥ vidhūmaḥ iva pāvakaḥ
translated: Born in the forest like a smokeless fire,

analyzed: parāśara kula udbhūtaḥ śukaḥ nāma mahā tapāḥ
translated: The one born in the family of Parāśara, the great ascetic named Śuka,

analyzed: sa tasyām pitṛ kanyāyām pīvaryām janayat vibhuḥ
translated: That powerful one begot him in that daughter of his father, Pīvarī.

analyzed: putrān pañca yoga caryā pariburṇān pariśrutān
translated: He had five sons, all well-versed in Yoga practices and austerities.

original: kṛṣṇā gauraṃ prabhuṃ śaṃbhuṃ tathā bhūriśrutaṃ ca vai // / / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇā gauram prabhum śaṃbhum tathā bhūriśrutam ca vai
translated: Krishna, Gaura, Prabhu, Shambhu, and Bhurishruta.

analyzed: kanyām kīrtimatīm ca eva yoginīm yoga mātaram
translated: And a daughter named Kirtimati, a Yogini and mother of Yoga.

analyzed: brahmadattasya cananī mahiṣī tu aṇuhasya sā
translated: She became the queen of Brahmadatta and the wife of Anuha.

analyzed: āditya kiraṇa upetam apunar mārgam āsthitaḥ
translated: Having attained the path of no return, illuminated by the rays of the sun,

analyzed: sarvavyāpī vinirmuktaḥ bhaviṣyati mahā muniḥ
translated: The great sage will become all-pervading and liberated.

analyzed: trayaḥ ete gāṇāḥ proktāḥ catuḥ śeṣān nibodhata
translated: These three classes of Pitris have been mentioned. Now listen to the remaining four.

analyzed: tān vakṣyāmi dvijaśreṣṭhāḥ prabhā mūrttimataḥ gaṇān
translated: O best of Brahmanas, I shall describe to you the classes of Pitris who are manifestations of light.

analyzed: utpannāḥ tu svadhāyām te kāvyāḥ hi agneḥ kaveḥ sutāḥ
translated: Born from the sacrificial libation, they are the sons of the wise Agni.

analyzed: pitaraḥ deva lokeṣu jyotiḥ bhāsiṣu bhāsvarāḥ
translated: The Pitris shine in the luminous worlds of the gods.

analyzed: sarva kāma samṛddheṣu dvijāḥ tān bhāvayanti uta
translated: The Brahmanas nourish them in places where all desires are fulfilled.

analyzed: eteṣām mānasī kanyā yoga utpattiḥ iti śrutā
translated: Their mental daughter is known as Yoga, born from Yoga.

original: dattā sanatkumāreṇa śukrasya mahiṣī tu yā /
analyzed: dattā sanatkumāreṇa śukrasya mahiṣī tu yā
translated: She was given to Shukra by Sanatkumara, and became his queen.

analyzed: ekaśṛṅgā iti vikhyātā bhṛgūṇām kīrti varddhinī
translated: Known as Ekasringa, she enhanced the glory of the Bhrigus.

original: marīci garbhāste lokāḥ samāvṛtya divi sthitāḥ /
analyzed: marīci garbhāḥ te lokāḥ samāvṛtya divi sthitāḥ
translated: The worlds called Marichigarbhas are situated in the sky, having covered them.

original: ete hyaṅgirasaḥ putrāḥ sādhyaiḥ saṃvarddhitāḥ purā // / / //
analyzed: ete hi aṅgirasaḥ putrāḥ sādhyaiḥ saṃvarddhitāḥ purā
translated: These are the sons of Angiras, formerly nourished by the Sadhyas.

original: upahūtāḥ smṛtāste vai pitaro bhāsvarā divi /
analyzed: upahūtāḥ smṛtāḥ te vai pitaraḥ bhāsvarāḥ divi
translated: They are considered to be invoked in the radiant sky as the ancestors.

analyzed: tān kṣatriya gaṇāḥ sapta bhāvayanti phala arthinaḥ
translated: The seven groups of Kshatriyas, desiring fruits, nourish them.

original: eteṣāṃ mānasī kanyā yaśodā nāma viśrutā /
analyzed: eteṣām mānasī kanyā yaśodā nāma viśrutā
translated: The famous mental daughter of these is named Yashoda.

original: matā yā jananī devī khaṭvāṅgasya mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: matā yā jananī devī khaṭvāṅgasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: She is considered to be the mother of the great-souled Khatvanga.

analyzed: yajñe yasya purā gītāḥ gāthā gītaiḥ mahā ṛṣibhiḥ
translated: In a sacrifice, the great sages sang a song about the birth of Agni,

analyzed: agneḥ janma tadā dṛṣṭvā śāṇḍilyasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: seeing the birth of the great-souled Shandilya.

analyzed: yajamānam dilīpam ye paśyanti atra samāhitāḥ
translated: Those who see the sacrificer Dilipa here with concentration,

analyzed: satya vratam mahātmānam te pi svarga jitaḥ narāḥ
translated: those men also conquer heaven.

original: ājyapā nāma pitaraḥ kardamasya prajā pateḥ /
analyzed: ājyapāḥ nāma pitaraḥ kardamasya prajā pateḥ
translated: The ancestors named Ajyapas are of the lord of beings Kardama.

analyzed: samutpannasya pulahāt utpannāḥ tasya te sutāḥ
translated: They were born from Pulaha when he was born.

analyzed: teṣu vaivartāḥ kāmagoṣu vihaṅgamāḥ
translated: Among them, the Vaivaritas, capable of going anywhere at will, are birds.

analyzed: etān vaiśya gaṇāḥ śrāddhe yanti phala arthinaḥ
translated: The groups of Vaishyas nourish them in a Shraddha, desiring fruits.

original: eteṣāṃ mānasī kanyā virajā nāma viśrutā /
analyzed: eteṣām mānasī kanyā virajā nāma viśrutā
translated: The daughter of these, born of their mind, is known as Viraja.

original: yayāterjananī sādhvī patnī sā nahuṣasya ca // / / //
analyzed: yayāteḥ jananī sādhvī patnī sā nahuṣasya ca
translated: She is the virtuous mother of Yayati and the wife of Nahusha.

analyzed: sukālāḥ nāma pitaraḥ vasiṣṭhasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: The Sukalas are the Pitris of the great Vasishtha.

analyzed: hairaṇyagarbhasya sutāḥ śūdrāḥ tām bhāvayanti uta
translated: They are the sons of Hiranyagarbha and the Shudras beget them.

original: mānasā nāma te lokā vartante yatra te divi /
analyzed: mānasāḥ nāma te lokāḥ vartante yatra te divi
translated: Those worlds are called Manasa and they exist where they are in heaven.

original: eteṣāṃ mānasī kanyā narmadā saritāṃ varā // / / //
analyzed: eteṣām mānasī kanyā narmadā saritām varā
translated: The daughter of these, born of their mind, is Narmada, the best of rivers.

original: sā bhāvayati bhūtāni dakṣiṇāpathagāminī /🔽jananī sātrasaddasyoḥ purukutsaparigrahaḥ // / / //
analyzed: sā bhāvayati bhūtāni dakṣiṇāpatha gāminī  jananī sātrasaddasyoḥ purukutsa parigrahaḥ
translated: She nourishes beings, flowing towards the southern path.🔽She is the mother of Satadas and Satrusad, and is the wife of Purukutsa.

analyzed: eteṣām abhyupagamāt manuḥ manvantara īśvaraḥ
translated: Manu, the lord of the Manu-antara, is accepted by them.

analyzed: manvantara ādau śrāddhāni pravartayati sarvaśas
translated: At the beginning of the Manu-antara, he performs all the Shraddhas.

analyzed: pitṝṇām ānupūrvyeṇa sarveṣām dvijasattamāḥ
translated: O best of the twice-born, he does this in the order of the Pitris.

analyzed: tasmāt etat svadharmeṇa deyam śrāddham ca śraddhayā
translated: Therefore, this Shraddha should be given with one's own duty and faith.

analyzed: sarveṣām rājataiḥ pātraiḥ api vā rajata anvitaiḥ
translated: Everything should be given in silver vessels or in vessels with silver.

original: dattaṃ svadhāṃ purodhāya śrāddhaṃ prīṇāti vai pitṝn // / / //
analyzed: dattam svadhām purodhāya śrāddham prīṇāti vai pitṝn
translated: The Shraddha given with Svaddha at the head pleases the Pitris.

analyzed: saumyāyane vā āgrayaṇe hi aśvamedham tat apnuyāt
translated: In the northern solstice, by performing the Agrayana sacrifice, one attains the horse sacrifice.

original: somaścāpyāyanaṃ kṛtvā hyaganervevasvatasya ca // / / //🔽pitṝnprīṇāti yo vaṃśyaḥ pitaraḥ prīṇayanti tam /
analyzed: somaḥ ca āpyāyanam kṛtvā hi aganeḥ vevasvatasya ca  pitṝn prīṇāti yaḥ vaṃśyaḥ pitaraḥ prīṇayanti tam
translated: Soma also, having performed the propitiation of Agni and Vivasvat's son,

analyzed: pitaraḥ puṣṭi kāmasya prajā kāmasya vā punar
translated: The one who delights the ancestors delights him. The ancestors delight him who desires prosperity or offspring again.

original: puṣṭiṃ prajāstathā svargaṃ prayacchanti na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: puṣṭim prajāḥ tathā svargam prayacchanti na saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that they grant prosperity, offspring, and heaven to one who desires prosperity or offspring.

analyzed: deva kāryāt api sadā pitṛ kāryam viśiṣyate
translated: The rite for the ancestors is always superior to the rite for the gods.

analyzed: devatābhyaḥ pitṝṇām hi pūrvam āpyāyanam smṛtam
translated: For the ancestors are remembered as being propitiated before the gods.

original: na hi yoga gatiḥ sūkṣmā pitṝṇāṃ na pitṛkṣayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na hi yoga gatiḥ sūkṣmā pitṝṇām na pitṛ kṣayaḥ
translated: The subtle path of yoga, the destruction of the ancestors, is not seen.

analyzed: tapasā viprasiddhena dṛśyate māsacakṣuṣā
translated: By austerity well-known, it is seen with the eye of the month.

analyzed: iti ete pitaraḥ ca eva lokāḥ duhitaraḥ ca vai
translated: Thus these are the ancestors, the worlds, and the daughters.

original: dauhitrā yajamānāśca proktā ye bhāvayanti yān /
analyzed: dauhitrāḥ yajamānāḥ ca proktāḥ ye bhāvayanti yān
translated: The grandsons are mentioned, whom the sacrificers nourish.

original: catvāro mūrtimantastu trayasteṣāmamūrtayaḥ // / / //🔽tebhyaḥ śrāddhāni satkṛtya devāḥ kurvanti yatnataḥ /
analyzed: catvāraḥ mūrtimantaḥ tu trayaḥ teṣām amūrtayaḥ  tebhyaḥ śrāddhāni satkṛtya devāḥ kurvanti yatnataḥ
translated: Four have form, three of them are formless.🔽The gods, with respect, carefully perform the sraddhas for them.

analyzed: bhaktyā prāñjalayaḥ sarve sa iṃdrāḥ tad gata mānasāḥ
translated: All of them, with Indra, with devotion, with folded hands, with their minds fixed on that.

analyzed: viśve ca sikatāḥ ca eva pṛśni jāḥ śṛṅgiṇaḥ tathā
translated: The Vishvas, the Sikatas, the Prisnijas, the Shringas,

analyzed: kṛṣṇāḥ śveta aṃbujāḥ ca eva vidhivat pūjayanti uta
translated: The Krishnas, the Shveta-ambus, all duly worshipped them.

analyzed: praśastāḥ vāta rasanāḥ divākṛtyāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: The Prashantas, the Vata-rasanas, the Divakritas,

analyzed: meghāḥ ca marutaḥ ca eva brahma ādyāḥ ca divaukasaḥ
translated: The clouds, the Maruts, the dwellers of heaven headed by Brahma,

analyzed: atri bhṛgu aṅgirāḥ ādyāḥ ca ṛṣayaḥ sarve eva te
translated: The Rishis Atri, Bhrigu, Angiras and all others,

original: yakṣā nāgāḥ suparṇāśca kinnarā rākṣasaiḥ saha // / / //
analyzed: yakṣāḥ nāgāḥ suparṇāḥ ca kinnarāḥ rākṣasaiḥ saha
translated: The Yakshas, the Nagas, the Suparnas, the Kinnaras, the Rakshasas,

analyzed: pitṝn te pūjayan sarve nityam eva phala arthinaḥ
translated: All of them worshipped the manes, always desiring fruits.

analyzed: evam ete mahātmānaḥ śrāddhe satkṛtya pūjitāḥ
