translated: Some enemies, frightened of that king, seeing the fist-like flames of his prowess, abandoned their homes and kingdom along with their sons and others.

original: dviṭsainyaiḥ samabhidrutā vanabhuvaṃ saṃprāpya tatrāpi te 'staimityaṃ samupāgatā giriguhāsuptotthitena dviṣaḥ // / / //🔽tālajaṅghānnihatyājau rājā sa balavāhanān /
analyzed: dviṣ sainyaiḥ samabhidrutāḥ vana bhuvam saṃprāpya tatra api te staimityam samupāgatāḥ giri guhā supta utthitena dviṣaḥ  tālajaṅghān nihatya ājau rājā sa bala vāhanān
translated: Attacked by the enemy's army, they reached the forest land and even there, they became immobile due to fatigue, like enemies rising from sleep in a mountain cave.

analyzed: krameṇa nāśayāmāsa tat rājyam arikarṣaṇaḥ  tatas yavana kāṃboja kirāta ādīn anekaśas
translated: Having killed the Tālajaṅghas in battle, the king, the destroyer of enemies, gradually destroyed their kingdom.

analyzed: nijaghāna ruṣā āviṣṭaḥ palhavān pāradān api
translated: Then, filled with anger, he killed the Yavanas, Kambojas, Kirātas, and many others, as well as the Pahlavas and Pāradas.

analyzed: hanyamānāḥ tu te sarve rājānaḥ tena saṃyuge
translated: All those kings, being killed by him in battle,

analyzed: dudruvuḥ saṃghaśas bhītāḥ hata śiṣṭāḥ samantataḥ
translated: frightened, fled in groups, the remaining survivors in all directions.

original: yuṣmābhiryasya rājyaṃ bahubhirapatdṛtaṃ tasya putro 'dhunāhaṃ hantuṃ vaḥ sapratijñaṃ prasabhamupagato vairaniryātanaiṣī /
analyzed: yuṣmābhiḥ yasya rājyam bahubhiḥ apatdṛtam tasya putraḥ dhuna aham hantum vaḥ sa pratijñam prasabham upagataḥ vaira niryātana eṣī
translated: The son of him whose kingdom was taken away by you all, has now come to you with a vow to kill you, eager to avenge the enmity.

original: ityuccaiḥ śrāvayāṇo yudhi nijacaritaṃ vairibhirnāgavīryaḥ kṣatrairvidhvaṃsitejāḥ sagaranarapatiḥ smārayāmāsa bhūpaḥ // / / //
analyzed: iti uccais śrāvayāṇaḥ yudhi nija caritam vairibhiḥ nāga vīryaḥ kṣatraiḥ vidhvaṃsi tejāḥ sagara narapatiḥ smārayāmāsa bhūpaḥ
translated: Thus proclaiming his deeds aloud in battle, the king Sagara, whose energy was destroyed by the Kshatriya enemies, the Nagas, remembered the past.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā rājavaryaṃ sakalaripukulaprakṣayopāttadīkṣaṃ bhītāḥ strībālapūrvaṃ śaraṇamabhiyayuḥ svāsusarakṣaṇāya /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā rāja varyam sakala ripu kula prakṣaya upātta dīkṣam bhītāḥ strī bāla pūrvam śaraṇam abhiyayuḥ sva asu sarakṣaṇāya
translated: Seeing that best of kings, who had taken up the vow to destroy the entire lineage of enemies, the frightened women and children, for the protection of their own lives, sought refuge with him.

original: ikṣvākūṇāṃ vasiṣṭhaṃ kulagurumabhitaḥ sapta rājñāṃ kaleṣu prakhyātāḥ saṃprasūtā nṛpavararipavaḥ pāradāḥ palhavādyāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ikṣvākūṇām vasiṣṭham kula gurum abhitas sapta rājñām kaleṣu prakhyātāḥ saṃprasūtāḥ nṛpa vara ripavaḥ pāradāḥ palhava ādyāḥ
translated: In the seven Kalas, the famous enemies of the best of kings, the Paradas, Palhavas and others, were born from the family preceptor Vasishtha of the Ikshvakus.

analyzed: vasiṣṭham āśrama upānte vasaṃtam ṛṣibhiḥ vṛtam
translated: Vasishtha, surrounded by sages, was dwelling near the hermitage.

analyzed: upagamya abruvan sarve kṛta añjali puṭāḥ nṛpāḥ
translated: Approaching him, all the kings spoke with folded hands.

analyzed: śaraṇam naḥ brahman ārttānām abhaya eṣiṇām
translated: O Brahman, be our refuge, we are afflicted and seek safety,

analyzed: sagara astra agni nirdagdha śarīrāṇām mumūrṣatām
translated: our bodies burnt by Sagara's fire, we are about to die.

analyzed: sa hanti asamāna śeṣeṇa vaira anta karaṇa unmukhaḥ
translated: He is bent on putting an end to hostilities, and he slays us with unequalled ferocity.

analyzed: tasmāt bhayāt hi niṣkrāntāḥ vayam jīvita kāṅkṣiṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, from fear of him, we have come out, desirous of saving our lives.

analyzed: vibhinna rājya bhoga ṛddhi sva dāra apatya bāndhavāḥ
translated: Our kingdoms, our enjoyments, our wealth, our wives, our children, and our relatives have been taken away from us.

original: kevalaṃ prāṇarakṣārthaṃ tvāṃ tvayaṃ śaraṇaṃ gataḥ // / / //
analyzed: kevalam prāṇa rakṣā artham tvām tu ayam śaraṇam gataḥ
translated: For the sake of saving our lives only, we have come to you for protection.

original: na hyanyo 'sti pumāṃlloke sauhṛdena balena vā /
analyzed: na hi anyaḥ sti pumān loke sauhṛdena balena vā
translated: There is no other man in the world, either through friendship or through strength,

analyzed: yaḥ tam nivarttayitvā asmān pālayet mahataḥ bhayāt
translated: who, having turned him away from us, could protect us from this great fear.

analyzed: tvam kila arka anvaya bhuvām rājñām kula guruḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: You are indeed chosen as the family preceptor of the kings of the solar dynasty.

analyzed: tad vaṃśa pūrvajaiḥ bhūpaiḥ tu ata prabhāvaḥ ca tādṛśaḥ  tena ayam sagaraḥ pi adya guru gaurava yantritaḥ
translated: And the power of your austerities is such that it was by you

analyzed: bhavat nideśam na atyeti velām iva mahā udadhiḥ
translated: that Sagara was restrained, and he does not transgress your command, like the great ocean does not transgress its shore.

original: tvaṃ naḥ suhṛtpitā mātā lokānāṃ ca gururvibho /
analyzed: tvam naḥ suhṛd pitā mātā lokānām ca guruḥ vibho
translated: You are our friend, father, mother, and preceptor of the worlds, O Lord.

analyzed: tasmāt asmān mahābhāga paritrātum tvam arhasi
translated: Therefore, O greatly fortunate one, it behoves you to protect us.

analyzed: jaiminiḥ uvāca
translated: Jaimini said:

analyzed: iti teṣām vacaḥ śrutvā vasiṣṭhaḥ bhagavān ṛṣiḥ
translated: Having heard these words of theirs, the illustrious sage Vashishtha,

translated: He slowly looked at those who had come for refuge.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tu atapyat bhagavān sarva bhūta anukaṃpakaḥ
translated: Seeing the kings' families, mostly consisting of old women and children, with only a few survivors left,🔽the Blessed One, the compassionate one towards all beings, was distressed.

translated: Having pondered for a long time and looked at them with respect,🔽the greatly wise one, reviving them slowly with his words, said, Do not be afraid.

analyzed: athā avocat mahābhāgaḥ kṛpayā parayā anvitaḥ
translated: Then the illustrious one, filled with great compassion,

analyzed: bhūpavyā kopa dagdham nṛpa kula vihita aśeṣa dharmāt apetam kṛtvā teṣām vasiṣṭhaḥ samayam avanipāla pratijñā nivṛttyai  gatvā tam rāja varyam svayam atha śanakais sāṃtvayitvā yathāvat sa prāṇānām arīṇām apagamana vidhau abhyanujñām yayāce
translated: Having made them abandon all the duties prescribed by the royal class, which were burnt by the fire of anger, and having made them turn away from all duties, Vasishtha,🔽having gone to that best of kings and slowly consoled him as befittingly as possible, asked for permission to engage in the task of removing the lives of his enemies.

original: sakrodho 'pi mahīpatirguruvacaḥ saṃbhāvayaṃstānarīndharmasya svakulocitasya ca tathā veṣasya saṃtyāgataḥ /

translated: Although the king was angry, he respected the words of his preceptor and gave up the duties of a warrior and the attire befitting his own royal family.

translated: The Brahmins, detached from the rites prescribed by the Vedas and Smritis, abandoned those kings one by one, as if they were dead, and kept away from them.

analyzed: evam virūpān anyān ca sa cakāra nṛpa anvayān

translated: Then those kings, having abandoned their own conduct and attire, immediately became the abode of mountain forests, caves, and so on.

translated: These castes, even now, are always despised by the virtuous on account of their evil practices, and are engaged in wicked deeds, O king, keeping their promise.

original: eṣā tvāṃ viṣṇunā sārddha dahāmi maghavanbalāt // / / //
analyzed: eṣā tvām viṣṇunā sārddha dahāmi maghavan balāt
translated: O Indra, I shall burn you down along with Vishnu by my power.

analyzed: miṣatā sarva bhūtānām dṛśyatām me tapaḥ balam
translated: While all the beings are watching, let them see the power of my penance.

analyzed: tayā abhibhūtau tau devau indrāviṣṇū jajalpatuḥ
translated: Overpowered by her, the two gods Indra and Vishnu whispered to each other:

analyzed: katham mucya iva sahitau viṣṇuḥ indram abhāṣata
translated: How can we two be freed? Vishnu spoke to Indra:

original: indro 'bravījjahi hyenāṃ yāvanno na dahe dvibho // / / //
analyzed: indraḥ bravīt jahi hi enām yāvat naḥ na dahe dvibho
translated: Indra said, Kill her before she burns us both, O Lord.

analyzed: viśeṣeṇa abhibhūtaḥ ham imām tat jahi māciram
translated: I am especially overpowered by her. Kill her quickly.

original: tataḥ samīkṣya tāṃ viṣṇuḥ strīvadhaṃ karttumāsthitaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tatas samīkṣya tām viṣṇuḥ strī vadham karttum āsthitaḥ
translated: Then Vishnu, seeing her, was about to kill her, a woman.

analyzed: abhidhyāya tatas śakram āpannam sa tvaram prabhuḥ
translated: The Lord, thinking of Indra who was in danger, quickly

analyzed: tasyāḥ saṃtvaramāṇāyāḥ śīghraṅkārī murāri hā
translated: Murari, the swift-acting one, of that one who was hurrying,

original: tridhā viṣṇustato devaḥ krūraṃ buddhvā cikīrṣitam /
analyzed: tridhā viṣṇuḥ tatas devaḥ krūram buddhvā cikīrṣitam
translated: Then the god Vishnu, knowing the cruel intention, divided himself into three.

analyzed: kruddhaḥ tat astram āvidhya śiraḥ ciccheda mādhavaḥ
translated: The angry Madhava drew that weapon and cut off her head.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā strīvadhaṃ ghoraṃ cukopa bhṛgurīśvaraḥ /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā strī vadham ghoram cukopa bhṛguḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: Seeing that terrible slaughter of women, Lord Bhrigu became angry.

analyzed: tatas bhiśaptaḥ bhṛguṇā viṣṇuḥ bhāryā vadhe tadā
translated: Then Vishnu, having killed his wife, was cursed by Bhrigu.

analyzed: yasmāt te jānatā dharmam avadhyā strī niṣūditā
translated: Since you, knowing Dharma, have slain an innocent woman who should not be killed,

analyzed: tasmāt tvam sapta kṛtvas vai manuṣyeṣu prapadyase
translated: therefore, you will be born seven times among humans.

analyzed: tatas tena abhiśāpena naṣṭe dharme punar punar
translated: Then, due to that curse, when Dharma was lost again and again,

analyzed: sarva loka hita arthāya jāyate mānuṣeṣu iha
translated: he is born among humans for the welfare of all the worlds.

original: anuvyāhṛtya viṣmuṃ sa tadādāya śiraḥ svayam /
analyzed: anuvyāhṛtya viṣmum sa tat ādāya śiraḥ svayam
translated: Having cursed Vishnu, he took up the head himself

analyzed: samānīya tatas kāye samāyojya idam abravīt
translated: and having brought it, having joined it to the body, he said this:

original: etāṃ tvāṃ viṣṇunā satyaṃ hatāṃ saṃjīvayāmyaham /
analyzed: etām tvām viṣṇunā satyam hatām saṃjīvayāmi aham
translated: By this truth, I revive you, Vishnu, who have been killed,

original: yadi kṛtsno mayā dharmaścarito jñāyate 'pi vā // / / //
analyzed: yadi kṛtsnaḥ mayā dharmaḥ caritaḥ jñāyate vā
translated: if all my Dharma is known to be practiced.

original: tena satyena jīvasva yadi satyaṃ bravīmyaham /
analyzed: tena satyena jīvasva yadi satyam bravīmi aham
translated: By that truth, live, if I speak the truth.

analyzed: satya abhivyahṛtāt tasya devī saṃjīvitā tadā
translated: By his truthful utterance, the goddess was revived then.

analyzed: tadā tām prokṣya śītābhiḥ adbhiḥ jīva iti saḥ bravīt
translated: Then, having sprinkled her with cold water, he said, Live!

analyzed: tatas tām sarva bhūtānām dṛṣṭvā supta utthitām iva
translated: Then, seeing her like one awakened from sleep, of all beings

analyzed: sādhu sādhu iti adṛśyānām vācaḥ tāḥ sasvanuḥ diśaḥ
translated: The directions resounded with the invisible voices exclaiming Well done! Well done!

original: dṛṣṭvā saṃjīvitāmevaṃ devīṃ tāṃ bhṛguṇā tadā // / / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā saṃjīvitām evam devīm tām bhṛguṇā tadā
translated: Seeing the goddess thus revived by Bhrigu,

analyzed: miṣatām sarva bhūtānām tat adbhutam iva abhavat
translated: it was as if a miracle had occurred in the presence of all beings.

analyzed: asaṃbhrāntena bhṛguṇā patnī saṃjīvitām tatas
translated: Then, while Bhrigu remained unperturbed, his wife was revived.

original: dṛṣṭvā śakro na lebhe 'tha śarma kāvyabhayāttataḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā śakraḥ na śarma kāvya bhayāt tatas
translated: Seeing this, Shakra (Indra) did not find peace, being afraid of Kavya (Bhrigu).🔽Then Indra, in the vigil,

analyzed: prajāgare tatas ca indraḥ jayantīm ātmanaḥ sutām
translated: spoke to his daughter Jayanti,

analyzed: provāca matimān vākyam svām kanyām pākaśāsanaḥ
translated: the wise chastiser of Paka (Indra) spoke these words to his own daughter:

original: eṣa kāvyo hyanindrāya carate dāruṇaṃ tapaḥ // / / //
analyzed: eṣa kāvyaḥ hi an indrāya carate dāruṇam tapaḥ
translated: This Kavya is indeed performing terrible austerities for the sake of Indra.

original: tenāhaṃ vyākulaḥ putri kṛto dhṛtimanā dṛḍham /
analyzed: tena aham vyākulaḥ putri kṛtaḥ dhṛti manāḥ dṛḍham
translated: O daughter, I am agitated by him. Be firm and steadfast.

analyzed: gaccha saṃbhāvayasva enam śrama apanayanaiḥ śubhe
translated: Go and honor him with means of removing fatigue, O auspicious one.

analyzed: taiḥ taiḥ manaḥ nukūlaiḥ ca hi upacāraiḥ
translated: With those and other pleasing services, not tired,
the goddess, the daughter of the lord of the gods, Jayanti, of auspicious conduct,

analyzed: su sva rūpa dha rāgāt tam durvaham vratam āsthitam
translated: assumed a beautiful form and approached him, who had undertaken an unbearable vow.

original: pitrā yathoktaṃ vākyaṃ sā kāvye kṛtavatī tadā // / / //
analyzed: pitrā yathā uktam vākyam sā kāvye kṛtavatī tadā
translated: Then she did as told by her father, to Kavya.

original: gīrbhiścaivānukūlābhiḥ stuvantī valgubhāṣiṇī /🔽gātrasaṃvāhanaiḥ kāle sevamānā tvacāsukhaiḥ // / / //
analyzed: gīrbhiḥ ca eva anukūlābhiḥ stuvantī valgu bhāṣiṇī  gātra saṃvāhanaiḥ kāle sevamānā tvacā asukhaiḥ
translated: And with agreeable words, she praised him, speaking sweetly.🔽And at the right time, she served him with massages, using pleasant unguents on his body.

analyzed: śuśrūṣantī anukūlā ca uvāsa bahulāḥ samāḥ
translated: And serving him, agreeable, she lived with him for many years.

analyzed: pūrṇam dhūmavrate ca api ghore varṣa sahasrake
translated: And when the terrible vow of smoke for a thousand years was completed,

analyzed: vareṇa kāvyam prītaḥ bhavaḥ tadā
translated: Shiva, being pleased, granted a boon to Kavya.

original: evaṃ vrataṃ tvayaikena cīrṇaṃ nānyena kena cit // / / //
analyzed: evam vratam tvayā ekena cīrṇam na anyena kena cid
translated: Thus, This vow has been observed by you alone, not by anyone else.

original: tasmāttvaṃ tapasā buddhyā śrutena ca balena ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tvam tapasā buddhyā śrutena ca balena ca
translated: Therefore, by your austerities, wisdom, learning, strength,

analyzed: tejasā vā api vibudhān sarvān abhibhaviṣyasi
translated: and radiance, you will surpass all the gods.

analyzed: yat ca kiñcid mama brahma vidyate bhṛgunandana
translated: And whatever knowledge of the Vedas exists in me, O delighter of the Bhrigus,

analyzed: sa aṃga ca sa rahasyam ca yajña upaniṣadaḥ tathā
translated: together with the Vedangas, the secrets, and the Upanishads of the sacrifices,

original: pratibhāti te sarvaṃ tadvācyaṃ tu na kasyacit /
analyzed: pratibhāti te sarvam tat vācyam tu na kasyacid
translated: all that knowledge appears to you, but it cannot be imparted to anyone else.

analyzed: sarva abhibhāvī tena tvam dvijaśreṣṭhaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: By that, you will become the foremost of Brahmanas, surpassing all.

original: evaṃ dattvā varaṃ tasyai bhārgavāya bhavaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: evam dattvā varam tasyai bhārgavāya bhavaḥ punar
translated: Having thus granted a boon to Bhargava, Shiva again

analyzed: prajā īśa tvam dhaneśa tvam avadhya tvam ca vai dadau
translated: granted him lordship over beings, lordship over wealth, and invincibility.

analyzed: etān labdhvā varān kāvyaḥ saṃprahṛṣṭa tanūruhaḥ
translated: Having obtained these boons, Kavya, with his body hair thrilled with joy,

analyzed: harṣāt prādur babhau tasya divyam stotram maheśituḥ
translated: Out of joy, he uttered this divine hymn to the great Lord.

analyzed: tadā tiryak sthitaḥ tu evam tuṣṭuve nīlalohitam
translated: Then, standing sideways, he praised the blue-throated Rudra.

analyzed: namaḥ stu śitikaṇṭhāya sura ādyāya suvarcase
translated: Salutations to the blue-throated one, to the one with excellent radiance, to the one who is worshipped by the gods and others.

analyzed: lelihānāya lehyāya vatsarāya jagatpate
translated: To the one who licks, to the one who is to be licked, to the one who is a year, to the lord of the universe.

analyzed: kapardine hi ūrddhva romṇe hari akṣa vara dāya ca
translated: To the one with matted hair, to the one with upward-pointing hair, to the one who grants boons, to the one with tawny eyes.

analyzed: saṃstutāya su tīrthāya devadevāya raṃhase
translated: To the one who is praised, to the one with excellent tirthas, to the god of gods, to the swift one.

analyzed: uṣṇīṣiṇe su vaktrāya sahasra akṣāya mīḍhuṣe
translated: To the one with a turban, to the one with an excellent face, to the thousand-eyed one, to the one who is generous.

original: vasuretāya rudrāya tapase cīravāsase /🔽nisvāya muktakeśāya senānye rohitāya ca // / / //
analyzed: vasu retāya rudrāya tapase cīra vāsase  nisvāya muktakeśāya senānye rohitāya ca
translated: To the one whose semen is the Vasus, to Rudra, to the one who is austere, to the one who wears garments made of bark.🔽To the one who is naked, to the one with loose hair, to the commander, to the red one.

original: kavaye rājavṛddhāya takṣakakrīḍanāya ca /🔽giriśāyārkanetrāya yataye cājyapāya ca // / / //
analyzed: kavaye rāja vṛddhāya takṣaka krīḍanāya ca  giriśāya arka netrāya yataye ca ājyapāya ca
translated: To the poet, to the one who is revered by kings, to the one who plays with Takshaka.🔽To the mountain-dweller, to the one with eyes like the sun, to the ascetic, to the one who drinks ghee.

original: suvṛttāya suhastāya dhanvine bhārgavāya ca /🔽sahasrabāhave caiva sahasrāmalacakṣuṣe // / / //
analyzed: su vṛttāya suhastāya dhanvine bhārgavāya ca  sahasra bāhave ca eva sahasra amala cakṣuṣe
translated: To the one with good conduct, to the one with good hands, to the archer, to the one who is the son of Bhrigu.🔽To the one with a thousand arms, to the one with a thousand pure eyes.

analyzed: sahasra kukṣaye ca eva sahasra caraṇāya ca
translated: To the one with a thousand stomachs, to the one with a thousand feet.

analyzed: sahasra śirase ca eva bahu rūpāya vedhase
translated: To the one with a thousand heads, and to the creator of many forms,

original: bhavāya viśvarūpāya śvetāya puruṣāya ca /🔽niṣaṅgiṇe kavacine sūkṣmāya kṣapaṇāya ca // / / //
analyzed: bhavāya viśva rūpāya śvetāya puruṣāya ca  niṣaṅgiṇe kavacine sūkṣmāya kṣapaṇāya ca
translated: To the one who exists, to the one of universal form, to the white one, to the supreme being,🔽To the one with a quiver, to the one with armor, to the subtle one, to the destroyer,

original: tāmrāya caiva bhīmāya ugrāya ca śivāya ca /
analyzed: tāmrāya ca eva bhīmāya ugrāya ca śivāya ca
translated: To the copper-colored one, to the fearful one, to the fierce one, to the auspicious one,

analyzed: mahādevāya sarvāya viśva rūpa śivāya ca
translated: To the great god, to the all-pervading one, to the one with a universal form and auspicious appearance,

original: hiraṇyāya vasiṣṭhāya varṣāya madhyamāya ca /🔽dhāmne caiva piśaṅgāya piṅgalāyāruṇāya ca // / / //🔽pinākine ceṣumate citrāya rohitāya ca /
analyzed: hiraṇyāya vasiṣṭhāya varṣāya madhyamāya ca  dhāmne ca eva piśaṅgāya piṅgalāya aruṇāya ca  pinākine ca iṣumate citrāya rohitāya ca
translated: To the golden one, to the best of sages, to the one who rains, to the middle one,🔽To the abode, to the tawny one, to the reddish-brown one, to the ruddy one,🔽To the wielder of the Pinaka bow, to the one who holds arrows, to the variegated one, to the red one,

analyzed: dundubhyāya eka pādāya arhāya buddhaye tathā
translated: To the one with a single foot, to the one who deserves worship, to the enlightened one,

analyzed: mṛgavyādhāya sarvāya sthāṇave bhīṣaṇāya ca
translated: To the hunter of deer, to the all-pervading one, to the immobile one, to the terrifying one,

analyzed: bahurūpāya ca ugrāya trinetrāya īśvarāya ca
translated: To the one of many forms, to the fierce one, to the three-eyed one, to the lord,

original: kapiloyaikavīrāya mṛtyave tryaṃbakāya ca // / / //🔽vāstoṣpate pinākāya śaṅkarāya śivāya ca /
analyzed: mṛtyave tryaṃbakāya ca  vāstoṣpate pinākāya śaṅkarāya śivāya ca
translated: To the tawny one, to the one with a single hero, to death, to the three-eyed one,🔽To the lord of the house, to the Pinaka bow, to the one who bestows happiness, to the auspicious one,

analyzed: āraṇyāya gṛhasthāya yatine bahmacāriṇe
translated: To the one in the forest, to the householder, to the ascetic, to the celibate,

original: sāṃkhyāya caiva yogāya dhyānine dīkṣitāya ca /
analyzed: sāṃkhyāya ca eva yogāya dhyānine dīkṣitāya ca
translated: To the one who practices Samkhya philosophy, to the one who practices yoga, to the one who meditates, to the initiated one,

analyzed: antarhitāya sarvāya tapyāya vyāpine tathā
translated: To the hidden, to all, to the one who burns, to the all-pervading, and likewise,

original: buddhāya caiva śuddhāya muktāya kevalāya ca /
analyzed: buddhāya ca eva śuddhāya muktāya kevalāya ca
translated: To the enlightened one, to the pure one, to the liberated one, to the sole one,

analyzed: rodhase caikitānāya brahmiṣṭhāya mahā ṛṣaye
translated: To the one who obstructs, to the one who knows everything, to the one who is most spiritual, to the great sage,

analyzed: catuṣpādāya medhyāya varmiṇe śīghra gāya ca
translated: To the one with four feet, to the pure one, to the armored one, to the swift one,

original: śikhaṇḍine kapālāya daṇḍine viśvamedhase // / / //🔽apratītāya dīptāya bhāskarāya sumedhase /
analyzed: śikhaṇḍine kapālāya daṇḍine viśva medhase  apratītāya dīptāya bhāskarāya sumedhase
translated: To the one with a crest, to the one with a skull, to the one with a staff, to the one who meditates on the universe,🔽To the one who is not known, to the radiant one, to the sun, to the one of good understanding,

analyzed: krūrāya vikṛtāya eva bībhatsāya śivāya ca
translated: To the cruel one, to the deformed one, to the disgusting one, to the auspicious one,

analyzed: śucaye paridhānāya sadyojātāya mṛtyave
translated: To the pure one, to the one who wears garments, to the one born in a moment, to death,

analyzed: piśita āśāya śarvāya meghāya vaidyutāya ca
translated: To the one who eats flesh, to Shiva, to the cloud, to the one with lightning,

analyzed: dakṣāya ca jaghanyāya lokānām īśvarāya ca
translated: To the dexterous one, to the one who is lowest, to the lord of the worlds,

analyzed: anāmayāya ca idhmāya hiraṇyāya eka cakṣuṣe
translated: To the one without disease, to the one with fuel, to the golden one, to the one with one eye,

analyzed: śreṣṭhāya vāmadevāya īśānāya ca dhīmate
translated: To the best one, to Vamadeva, to the wise lord,

analyzed: mahā kalpāya dīptāya rodanāya hasāya ca
translated: To the great eon, to the radiant one, to the weeping one, to the laughing one,

analyzed: dṛḍha dhanvine kavacine rathine ca varūthine
translated: To the one with a firm bow, to the one with armor, to the one with a chariot, to the one with a fortress,

analyzed: bhṛgu nāthāya śukrāya gahvariṣṭhāya dhīmate
translated: To the lord of Bhrigu, to Shukra, to the wisest one, to the intelligent one,

analyzed: amoghāya praśāntāya sadā vipra priyāya ca
translated: To the one whose purpose is never futile, to the peaceful one, to the one who is always dear to the Brahmins,

analyzed: digvāsaḥ kṛtti vāsāya bhaga ghnāya namaḥ stu te
translated: To the one who wears the quarters as garments, to the one who wears the hide, to the destroyer of Bhaga, salutations to you.

original: paśūnāṃ pataye caiva bhūtānāṃ pataye namaḥ /
analyzed: paśūnām pataye ca eva bhūtānām pataye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the lord of animals and to the lord of beings,

original: prabhave ṛgyajuḥsāmne svāhāyai ca sudhāya ca // / / //
analyzed: prabhave ṛk yajuḥ sāmne svāhāyai ca sudhāyai ca
translated: To the creator, to the one who is the Rig, Yajus and Sama Veda, to the one who is the Svâhâ and Sudhâ,

analyzed: vaṣaṭkāra tamāya eva tubhyam mantra ātmane namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you who are the most excellent of the Vaṣaṭkāra, to the one whose essence is the mantra,

original: sraṣṭre dhātre tathā kartre hartre ca kṣapaṇāya ca // / / //
analyzed: sraṣṭre dhātre tathā kartre hartre ca kṣapaṇāya ca
translated: To the creator, to the sustainer, to the one who acts, to the one who destroys, to the one who annihilates,

analyzed: bhūta bhavya bhaveśāya tubhyam karma ātmane namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you who are the lord of the past, present and future, to the one whose essence is action,

analyzed: vasave ca eva sādhyāya rudra āditya aśvināya ca
translated: To the Vasus, to the Sâdhyas, to Rudra, to the Adityas, to the Aśvins,

original: viśvāya marute caiva tubhyaṃ devātmane namaḥ /
analyzed: viśvāya marute ca eva tubhyam deva ātmane namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you who are the universe, to the Maruts, to the one whose essence is the gods,

analyzed: agnīṣoma vidhi jñāya paśu mantrau sadhāya ca
translated: To the one who knows the rites of Agni and Soma, to the one who is endowed with animals and herbs,

analyzed: dakṣiṇa avabhṛthāya eva tubhyam yajña ātmane namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you who are the essence of sacrifice, to the one who is the Dakṣiṇâ and Avabhṛtha,

original: tapase caiva satyāya tyāgāya ca śamāya ca // / / //
analyzed: tapase ca eva satyāya tyāgāya ca śamāya ca
translated: To austerity, to truth, to renunciation, to tranquility,

analyzed: ahiṃsāya atha lobhāya su veṣāya aniśāya ca
translated: To non-violence, to non-greed, to good attire, to the sleepless one,

analyzed: sarva bhūtāt prabhūtāya tubhyam yoga ātmane namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you who are the lord of all beings, to the one whose essence is yoga.

analyzed: pṛthivyai ca antarikṣāya mahāse tridivāya ca
translated: To the earth, the atmosphere, the great sacrifice, and the heaven of the thirty-three gods,

analyzed: janaḥ tapāya satyāya tubhyam loka ātmane namaḥ
translated: To the people, to austerity, to truth, to you, the soul of the worlds, I offer salutations.

analyzed: avyaktāya atha mahate bhūtāya eva indriyāya ca
translated: To the unmanifest, to the great, to the elements, to the senses,

analyzed: tanmātrāya atha mahate tubhyam tattva ātmane namaḥ
translated: To the subtle elements, to the great, to you, the soul of the principles, I offer salutations.

analyzed: nityāya ca api aliṅgāya sūkṣmāya ca itarāya ca
translated: To the eternal, to the formless, to the subtle, to the other,

original: śuddhāya vibhave caiva tubhyaṃ nityātmane namaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śuddhāya vibhave ca eva tubhyam nitya ātmane namaḥ
translated: To the pure, to the glorious, to you, the eternal soul, I offer salutations.

analyzed: namaḥ te triṣu lokeṣu svar anteṣu bhuva ādiṣu
translated: Salutations to you who are in the three worlds, in the elements beginning with earth,

analyzed: satya anta mahar ādyeṣu caturṣu ca namaḥ stu te
translated: In the four beginning with the day ending with truth, salutations to you.

analyzed: nāma stotre mayā hi asmin yat asat vyāhṛtam prabho
translated: In this hymn of praise by me, O Lord, if anything improper has been uttered,

analyzed: mad bhaktaḥ iti brahmaṇya sarvam tat kṣantum arhasi
translated: O Brahman, as I am your devotee, please forgive all of it.

analyzed: anapatyaḥ maruttaḥ tu sa rājā āsīt iti śrutam

original: duṣkantaṃ pauravaṃ cāpi sa vai putramakalpayat // / / //🔽evaṃ yayātiśāpena jarāsaṃkramaṇe purā /
analyzed: duṣkantam pauravam ca api sa vai putram akalpayat  evam yayāti śāpena jarā saṃkramaṇe purā
translated: He adopted Duskanta of the Puru race as his son.

original: turvasoḥ pauravaṃ vaṃśaṃ praviveśa purā kila // / / //
analyzed: turvasoḥ pauravam vaṃśam praviveśa purā kila
translated: Thus, in ancient times, due to the curse of Yayati, the Puru race of Turvasu entered the Paurava race.

original: duṣkantasya tu dāyādaḥ sarūpyo nāma pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: duṣkantasya tu dāyādaḥ sarūpyaḥ nāma pārthivaḥ
translated: Duskanta's successor was the king named Sarupya.

analyzed: sarūpyāt tu tathā aṇḍīraḥ catvāraḥ tasya ca ātmajāḥ
translated: From Sarupya came Andira, and he had four sons.

analyzed: pāṇḍyaḥ ca keralaḥ ca eva colaḥ kulyaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: They were Pandya, Kerala, Chola, and Kuly.

analyzed: teṣām janapadāḥ kulyāḥ pāṇḍyāḥ colāḥ sa keralāḥ
translated: Their countries are Kulyas, Pandyas, Cholas and Keralas.

original: druhyośca tanayau vīrau babhruḥ setuśca viśrutau /
analyzed: druhyoḥ ca tanayau vīrau babhruḥ setuḥ ca viśrutau
translated: And Druhyu's sons were the heroes Babhru and the famous Setu.

analyzed: aruddhaḥ setu putraḥ tu bābravaḥ ripuḥ ucyate
translated: Aruddh was Setu's son, and Babhru's son is said to be Ripu.

analyzed: yauvanāśvena samitau kṛccheṇa nihataḥ balī
translated: He was killed with difficulty by Yauvanashva in a battle.

analyzed: yuddham su mahat āsīt tu māsān pari caturdaśa
translated: There was a great battle for fourteen months.

original: aruddhasya tu dāyādo gāndhāro nāma pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: aruddhasya tu dāyādaḥ gāndhāraḥ nāma pārthivaḥ
translated: Aruddh's heir was the king named Gandhara.

original: khyāyate yasya nāmnā tu gāndhāraviṣayo mahān // / / //
analyzed: khyāyate yasya nāmnā tu gāndhāra viṣayaḥ mahān
translated: The great country of Gandhara is known by his name.

analyzed: gāndhārā deśa jāḥ ca api turagāḥ vājinām varāḥ
translated: And the horses born in the land of Gandhara are the best of horses.

analyzed: gāndhāra putraḥ dharmaḥ tu dhṛtaḥ tasya sutaḥ bhavat
translated: Gandhara's son was Dharma, and his son was Dhrita.

analyzed: dhṛtasya durdamaḥ jajñe pracetāḥ tasya ca ātmajaḥ
translated: Dhrita's son was Durdama, and his son was Pracheta.

original: pracetasaḥ putraśataṃ rājānaḥ sarva eva te // / / //
analyzed: pracetasaḥ putra śatam rājānaḥ sarve eva te
translated: Pracheta had a hundred sons, all of whom were kings.

analyzed: mleccha rāṣṭra adhipāḥ sarve hi udīcīm diśam āsthitāḥ
translated: All of them were rulers of the Mleccha kingdoms, situated in the north.

analyzed: anoḥ ca eva sutāḥ vīrāḥ trayaḥ parama dhārmikāḥ
translated: And Anu had three sons, who were very righteous heroes.

analyzed: sabhānaraḥ kālacakṣuḥ parākṣaḥ ca iti viśrutāḥ
translated: They were known as Sabhanara, Kalachukra and Paraksha.

original: sabhānarasya putrastu vidvānkālānalo nṛpaḥ // / / //🔽kālānalasya dharmātmā sṛṃjayo nāma viśrutaḥ /
analyzed: sabhānarasya putraḥ tu vidvān kālānalaḥ nṛpaḥ  kāla analasya dharma ātmā sṛṃjayaḥ nāma viśrutaḥ
translated: The son of Sabhanara was the learned king Kalana.🔽Kalana's son was the righteous and famous Srinjaya.

analyzed: sṛṃjayasya abhavat putraḥ vīraḥ nāmnā purañjayaḥ
translated: Srinjaya's son was the heroic Puranjaya.

analyzed: āsīt indra samaḥ rājā pratiṣṭita yaśāḥ divi
translated: He was a king equal to Indra and his fame was established in all directions.

analyzed: mahāmanāḥ sutaḥ tasya mahāśālasya dhārmikaḥ
translated: His son was the righteous Mahamana, the son of Mahashala.

analyzed: saptadvīpā īśvaraḥ rājā cakravarttī mahā yaśāḥ
translated: He was a king, a Chakravartin, a lord of the seven islands, and greatly famous.

analyzed: mahāmanāḥ tu dvau putrau janayāmāsa viśrutau
translated: Mahamana begot two famous sons:

original: uśīnaraṃ ca dharmajñaṃ titikṣuṃ caiva dhārmikam /
analyzed: uśīnaram ca dharma jñam titikṣum ca eva dhārmikam
translated: Ushinaras, who knew dharma, and Titikshu, who was righteous.

analyzed: uśīnarasya patnyaḥ tu pañca rājarṣi vaṃśa jāḥ
translated: Ushinaras had five wives born in the families of royal sages:

original: nṛgā kṛmī navā darvā pañcamī ca dṛṣadvatī /
analyzed: nṛgā kṛmī navā darvā pañcamī ca dṛṣadvatī
translated: Nriga, Krimi, Nava, Darva, and the fifth was Drishadvati.

analyzed: uśīnarasya putryaḥ tu pañca tāsu kula udvahāḥ
translated: Ushinaras had five sons born from them, who perpetuated the family:

analyzed: tapasyataḥ su mahataḥ jātāḥ vṛddhasya dhārmikāḥ
translated: They were born to the righteous old king while he was engaged in great austerities.

original: nṛgāyāstu nṛgaḥ putro navāyā nava eva tu // / / //
analyzed: nṛgāyāḥ tu nṛgaḥ putraḥ navāyāḥ navaḥ eva tu
translated: Nriga was the son of Nriga, Nava was the son of Nava,

original: kṛmyāḥ kṛmistu darvāyāḥ suvrato nāma dhārmikaḥ /
analyzed: kṛmyāḥ kṛmiḥ tu darvāyāḥ suvrataḥ nāma dhārmikaḥ
translated: Krimi was the son of Krimi, and Suvrata, the righteous one, was the son of Darva.

analyzed: dṛṣadvatī sutaḥ ca api śibiḥ auśīnaraḥ dvijāḥ
translated: And his son was Drishadvati, and Shibi, the son of Ushinara, O Brahmanas.

original: śibe śivapuraṃ khyātaṃ yaudheyaṃ tu nṛgasya ca /
analyzed: śibe śiva puram khyātam yaudheyam tu nṛgasya ca
translated: The city of Shibi was known as Shivi-pura, and that of Nriga as Yaudheyapura.

original: navasya navarāṣṭraṃ tu kṛmestu kṛmilā purī // / / //
analyzed: navasya navarāṣṭram tu kṛmeḥ tu kṛmilā purī
translated: The city of Nava was known as Navarashtra, and that of Kritu as Krimila.

analyzed: suvratasya tathā aṃbaṣṭā śibi putrān nibodhata
translated: The city of Suvrata was known as Ambashta. Now hear the names of the sons of Shibi.

analyzed: śibeḥ tu śibayaḥ putrāḥ catvāraḥ loka saṃmatāḥ
translated: Shibi had four sons, known in the world as Shivi's sons.

analyzed: vṛṣadarbhaḥ suvīraḥ tu kekayaḥ madrakaḥ tathā
translated: They were Vrishadarbha, Suvira, Kekaya and Madra.

original: teṣāṃ janapadāḥ sphītāḥ kekayā madrakāstathā // / / //🔽vṛṣadarbhāḥ suvīrāśca titikṣoḥ śṛṇuta prajāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām janapadāḥ sphītāḥ kekayāḥ madrakāḥ tathā  vṛṣa darbhāḥ su vīrāḥ ca titikṣoḥ śṛṇuta prajāḥ
translated: Their prosperous countries were known as Kekaya, Madra,🔽Vrishadarbha and Suvira. Now hear the names of the sons of Titiksha.

analyzed: titikṣuḥ abhavat rājā pūrvasyām diśi viśrutaḥ
translated: Titiksha was a famous king in the east.

analyzed: uśadrathaḥ mahā bāhuḥ tasya hemaḥ sutaḥ bhavat
translated: His son was the mighty-armed Ushadgu, whose son was Hema.

original: hemasya sutapā jajñe sutaḥ sutapaso baliḥ // / / //
analyzed: hemasya sutapāḥ jajñe sutaḥ sutapasaḥ baliḥ
translated: Hema's son was Sutapa, and Sutapa's son was Bali.

original: jāto manuṣyayonyāṃ vai kṣīṇe vaṃśe prajepsayā /
analyzed: jātaḥ manuṣya yonyām vai kṣīṇe vaṃśe prajā īpsayā
translated: He was born in the human womb, when his race was extinct, from a desire for progeny.

original: mahāyogī sa tu balirbaddho yaḥ sa mahāmanāḥ // / / //
analyzed: mahā yogī sa tu baliḥ baddhaḥ yaḥ sa mahā manāḥ
translated: That great ascetic Bali, who was bound by the great-minded one,

analyzed: putrān utpādayāmāsa jātuḥ varṇya karān bhuvi
translated: Begot sons who were the founders of the four castes on earth.

original: aṅgaṃ sa janayāmāsa vaṅgaṃ suhmaṃ tathaiva ca // / / //
analyzed: aṅgam sa janayāmāsa vaṅgam suhmam tathā eva ca
translated: He begot Anga, Vanga, and also Suhma.

original: yuddhaṃ kaliṅgaṃ ca tathā vāleyaṃ kṣatramucyate /🔽vāleyā brāhmaṇāścaiva tasya vaṃśakarāḥ prabhoḥ // / / //
analyzed: yuddham kaliṅgam ca tathā vāleyam kṣatram ucyate  vāleyāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ ca eva tasya vaṃśa karāḥ prabhoḥ
translated: And also Yuddha, Kalinga, and Valeyam is said to be the Kshatriya.🔽And the Brahmanas of Valeyam are the perpetuators of his dynasty, O lord.

original: balestu brahmaṇā dattā varāḥ prītena dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: baleḥ tu brahmaṇā dattāḥ varāḥ prītena dhīmataḥ
translated: And to Vali, the wise one, being pleased, Brahma gave boons.

analyzed: mahā yogi tvam āyuḥ ca kalpasya parimāṇakam
translated: The state of a great yogi, and life equal to a Kalpa in duration,

analyzed: saṃgrāme vā api ajeya tvam dharme ca eva prabhāvataḥ
translated: And invincibility in battle, and in righteousness also by his power,

analyzed: trailokya darśanam ca eva prādhānyam prasave tathā
translated: And the sight of the three worlds, and pre-eminence in progeny,

analyzed: baleḥ ca pratima tvam dharma tattva artha darśanam
translated: And the state of being matchless to Vali, and the sight of the truth of Dharma,

analyzed: caturaḥ niyatān varṇān tvam vai sthāpayitā iti vai
translated: And you alone shall establish the four well-defined castes.

original: ityukto vibhunā rājā baliḥ śānti parāyayau /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ vibhunā rājā baliḥ śānti parāyayau
translated: Thus addressed by the lord, king Vali attained peace.

analyzed: kālena mahatā vidvān svam ca sthānam upāgataḥ
translated: And after a long time, the wise one attained his own place.

analyzed: teṣām janapadāḥ sphītāḥ aṅga vaṅgāḥ ca suhmakāḥ
translated: Their prosperous countries were Anga, Vanga, and Suhma,

original: puṇḍrāḥ kaliṅgaśca tathā teṣāṃ vaṃśaṃ nibodhata // / / //
analyzed: puṇḍrāḥ kaliṅgaḥ ca tathā teṣām vaṃśam nibodhata
translated: Pundra, and Kalinga also. Know their dynasty.

original: tasya te tanayāḥ sarve kṣetrajā munisaṃbhavāḥ /
analyzed: tasya te tanayāḥ sarve kṣetrajāḥ muni saṃbhavāḥ
translated: And all those sons of his were Kshetrajas born of a Shudra woman, O king.

analyzed: saṃbhūtāḥ dīrghatamasaḥ sudeṣṇāyām mahā ojasaḥ
translated: were born to Sudeshna, the daughter of Dirghatamas, of great prowess.

analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The Rishis said:

original: kathaṃ baleḥ sutāḥ pañca janitāḥ kṣetrajāḥ prabho /
analyzed: katham baleḥ sutāḥ pañca janitāḥ kṣetrajāḥ prabho
translated: How were the five daughters of Bali born as Kshetrajas (adopted daughters) of the lord?

analyzed: ṛṣiṇā dīrghatamasā hi etat prabrūhi pṛcchatām
translated: Please tell us who are asking, how this happened through the Rishi Dirghatamas.

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

analyzed: uśijaḥ nāma vikhyātaḥ āsīt hīmān ṛṣiḥ purā
translated: In ancient times, there was a famous and wise Rishi named Ushija.

original: bhāryā vai mamatā nāma babhūvāsya mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhāryā vai mamatā nāma babhūva asya mahātmanaḥ
translated: The great soul had a wife named Mamata.

analyzed: uśijasya kanīyān tu purodhāḥ yaḥ divaukasām
translated: The younger brother of Ushija, who was the priest of the gods,

analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ bṛhat tejāḥ mamatām saḥ bhyapadyata
translated: was Brihaspati of great brilliance, who approached Mamata.

analyzed: uvāca mamatā tam tu bṛhaspatim an icchatī
translated: Mamata, who was unwilling, said to Brihaspati:

analyzed: antarvatnī asmi te bhrātuḥ jyeṣṭhasya asya ca bhāminī
translated: I am pregnant with the child of your elder brother, the beautiful one.

original: ayaṃ hi me mahāngarbho roravīti bṛhaspate /
analyzed: ayam hi me mahān garbhaḥ roravīti bṛhaspate
translated: O Brihaspati, this great embryo of mine is crying.

analyzed: ajasram brahma ca abhyasya ṣaṣ aṅgam vedam udgiran
translated: Constantly reciting the Vedas with six limbs, it is vomiting them out.

original: amoghare tāstvaṃ cāpi na māṃ bhajitumarhasi /
analyzed: amoghare tāḥ tvam ca api na mām bhajitum arhasi
translated: Your seed is never wasted, and you should not have intercourse with me.

original: asminneva yathākāle yathā vā manyase vibho // / / //
analyzed: asmin eva yathākāle yathā vā manyase vibho
translated: At this time, or whenever you think fit, O lord.

analyzed: evam uktaḥ tayā samyak bṛha tejāḥ bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: Thus addressed by her, Brihaspati of great brilliance,

original: kāmātmānaṃ mahātmāpi nātmānaṃ so 'bhyadhārayat // / / //🔽saṃbabhūvaiva dharmātmā tayā sārddhaṃ bṛhaspati /
analyzed: kāma ātmānam mahātmā api na ātmānam saḥ bhyadhārayat  saṃbabhūva eva dharma ātmā tayā sārddham bṛhaspati
translated: The high-souled one, though not having a soul subject to desire, did not restrain his soul.🔽The righteous-souled Brihaspati, however, was born with her.

original: utsṛjantaṃ tadā reto garbhasthaḥ so 'sya bhāṣata // / / //
analyzed: utsṛjantam tadā retaḥ garbha sthaḥ saḥ sya bhāṣata
translated: The embryo in his womb then spoke to him as he was about to cast his seed.

original: śukraṃ tyākṣīśca mā jīva dvayornehāsti saṃbhavaḥ /
analyzed: śukram tyākṣīḥ ca mā jīva dvayoḥ na iha asti saṃbhavaḥ
translated: Cast not thy seed, for there can be no possibility of two (persons) being born here.

original: amogharetāstvaṃ vāpi pūrvaṃ cāhamihāgataḥ // / / //🔽śaśāpa taṃ tadā kruddha evamukto bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: amogha retāḥ tvam vā api pūrvam ca aham iha āgataḥ  śaśāpa tam tadā kruddhaḥ evam uktaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: Thou art of unfailing seed, but I came here first.

original: uśijasya sutaṃ bhrāturgarbhasthaṃ bhagavānṛṣiḥ // / / //🔽yasmāttvamīdṛśe kāle sarvabhūtepsite sati /
analyzed: uśijasya sutam bhrātuḥ garbha stham bhagavān ṛṣiḥ  yasmāt tvam īdṛśe kāle sarva bhūta īpsite sati
translated: Thus addressed, the illustrious Rishi Brihaspati, the brother of Ushija, in anger cursed the embryo in his womb.

analyzed: mām evam uktavān mohāt tamaḥ dīrgham
translated: Since thou hast spoken to me thus at this time when all creatures are asleep, out of folly, thou shalt behold long darkness.

analyzed: tatas dīrghatamāḥ nāma śāpāt ṛṣiḥ ajāyata  atha auśijaḥ bṛhat kīrtiḥ bṛhaspatiḥ iba ojasā
translated: Then was born the Rishi named Dirghatama (long-lived) through the curse.🔽Then the illustrious Ushija, like Brihaspati in prowess,

analyzed: ūrddhvaretāḥ tatas ca api nyavasat bhrātuḥ āśrame
translated: lived in his brother's hermitage, with his seed drawn up.

analyzed: go dharmam saurabheyāt tu vṛṣabhāt śatavān prabhoḥ
translated: From the bull, the lord of the cows, he obtained a hundred sons, following the vow of Brahmacharya.

original: tasya bhrātā pitṛvyastu cakāra bhavanaṃ tadā /
analyzed: tasya bhrātā pitṛvyaḥ tu cakāra bhavanam tadā
translated: His brother, the maternal uncle, then built a palace for him.

original: tasminhi tatra vasati yadṛcchābhyāgato vṛṣaḥ // / / //🔽darśārthamāstṛtāndarbhāñcacāra surabhīsutaḥ /
analyzed: tasmin hi tatra vasati yadṛcchā abhyāgataḥ vṛṣaḥ  darśa artham āstṛtān darbhān cacāra surabhīsutaḥ
translated: For a bull, who had come there by chance, was living there.🔽The son of Surabhi (Airsava) roamed there, with his horns covered with grass for the purpose of being seen.

original: jagrāha taṃ dīrgha tamā visphurantaṃ tu śṛṅgayoḥ // / / //
analyzed: jagrāha tam dīrgha tamāḥ visphurantam tu śṛṅgayoḥ
translated: He seized that bull, who was trembling with his horns.

original: sa tena nigṛhītastu na cacāla padātpadam /
analyzed: sa tena nigṛhītaḥ tu na cacāla padāt padam
translated: Though seized by him, he did not move even a step.

original: tato 'bravīd vṛṣastaṃ vai suṃca māṃ balināṃ vara // / / //
analyzed: tatas bravīt vṛṣaḥ tam vai suṃca mām balinām vara
translated: Then the bull said to him, O Sucha, seize me, the best among the strong.

analyzed: na mayā sāditaḥ tāta balavān tadvidhaḥ kvacid
translated: O father, I have never been defeated by anyone as strong as him.

original: tryaṃbakaṃ vahatā devaṃ yato jāto 'smi bhūtale // / / //
analyzed: tryaṃbakam vahatā devam yatas jātaḥ smi bhū tale
translated: Since I was born on the earth, bearing the three-eyed god.

original: suṃca māṃ balināṃ śreṣṭha pratisnehaṃ varaṃ vṛṇu /
analyzed: suṃca mām balinām śreṣṭha pratisneham varam vṛṇu
translated: Sucha, choose a boon from me, the best among the strong, as a token of affection.

analyzed: evam uktaḥ bravīt enam jīvan tvam me kva yāsyasi
translated: Thus addressed, he said to him, Where will you go, O Jiva, while I am alive?

original: tena tvāhaṃ na mokṣyāmi parasvādaṃ catuṣpadam /
analyzed: tena tvā aham na mokṣyāmi para svādam catuṣpadam
translated: Therefore, I will not release you, O four-footed one, who has taken away another's property.

original: tatastaṃ dīrghatamasaṃ sa vṛṣaḥ pratyuvāca ha // / / //🔽nāsmākaṃ vidyate tāta pātakaṃ steyameva ca /
analyzed: tatas tam dīrghatamasam sa vṛṣaḥ pratyuvāca ha  na asmākam vidyate tāta pātakam steyam eva ca
translated: Then that bull replied to Dirghatama,🔽O father, we do not have any sin or theft.

original: bhakṣyābhakṣyaṃ na jānīmaḥ peyāpeyaṃ ca sarvaśaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bhakṣya abhakṣyam na jānīmaḥ peya apeyam ca sarvaśas
translated: We do not know what is edible and what is not, what is drinkable and what is not, in every way.

original: kāryā kāryaṃ ca vai vipra gamyagamyaṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: kāryā kāryam ca vai vipra gamya gamyam tathā eva ca
translated: O Brahmana, we have to distinguish between what should be done and what should not be done, and between what is proper and what is improper.

original: na pāpmāno vayaṃ vipra dharmo hyeṣa gavāṃ śrutaḥ // / / //
analyzed: na pāpmānaḥ vayam vipra dharmaḥ hi eṣa gavām śrutaḥ
translated: O Brahmana, we are not sinful. This is the duty of cows as we have heard.

original: gavāṃ nāma sa ve śrutvā saṃbhrāntasta mamuñcata /🔽bhaktyā cānuśravikayā gosutaṃ vai prasādayan // / / //
analyzed: gavām nāma sa veḥ śrutvā saṃbhrāntaḥ taḥ mamuñcata  bhaktyā ca ānuśravikayā gosutam vai prasādayan
translated: Having heard the name of cows, he was frightened and let him go.🔽And pleasing Gosuta with devotion and the sacred texts,

original: prasādato vṛṣendrasya godharmaṃ jagṛhe 'tha saḥ /🔽manasaiva tadā dadhre tadvidhastatparāyaṇaḥ // / / //🔽tato yavīyasaḥ patnīmautathyasyābhyamanyata /
analyzed: prasādataḥ vṛṣa indrasya go dharmam jagṛhe saḥ  manasā eva tadā dadhre tadvidhaḥ tad parāyaṇaḥ  tatas yavīyasaḥ patnīm autathyasya abhyamanyata
translated: he then accepted the duty of a cow by the grace of the lord of bulls.🔽With his mind alone, he then took up that duty, being of that kind and devoted to it.🔽Then, by fate, his mind confused, he desired the wife of his younger brother,

analyzed: viceṣṭamānām rudatīm daivāt saṃmūḍha cetanaḥ
translated: who was moving about and weeping.

analyzed: avalepam tu tam matvā suradvān tasya nā akṣamat
translated: But Suradva, considering that an insult, did not tolerate it.

original: godharma vai balaṃ kṛtvā snuṣāṃ sa hyabhyamanyata // / / //
analyzed: godharma vai balam kṛtvā snuṣām sa hi abhyamanyata
translated: Considering the duty of a cow to be strength, he desired his daughter-in-law.

original: viparyayaṃ tu taṃ dṛṣṭvā śaradvānpravicintya ca /
analyzed: viparyayam tu tam dṛṣṭvā śaradvān pravicintya ca
translated: But Sharadvan, seeing that reversal and reflecting on it,

analyzed: sahasrāṇām śatāni iha trīṇi mānuṣa saṃkhyayā
translated: Three hundred and sixty thousand years, according to human reckoning,

original: ṣaṣṭiṃ caiva sahasrāṇi varṣāṇāṃ tūcyate kaliḥ // / / //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭim ca eva sahasrāṇi varṣāṇām tu ucyate kaliḥ
translated: are said to constitute the Kali age.

original: divyaṃ varṣasahasraṃ tu tatsaṃdhyāṃśe hi kīrtite /
analyzed: divyam varṣa sahasram tu tat saṃdhyāṃśe hi kīrtite
translated: That is declared to be the twilight period, lasting for a thousand divine years.

original: niḥśeṣe ca tadā tasminkṛtaṃ vai pratipatsyate // / / //
analyzed: niḥśeṣe ca tadā tasmin kṛtam vai pratipatsyate
translated: When that is over, the Krita age will set in again.

analyzed: elaḥ ca ikṣvāku vaṃśaḥ ca saha bhedaiḥ prakīrtitau
translated: The families of Ila and Ikshvaku, with their divisions, have been described.

analyzed: ikṣvākoḥ tu samṛtam kṣattram sumitrā antam vivasvataḥ
translated: The Kshatriya race of Ikshvaku, ending with Sumitra, is known to be that of Vivasvat.

original: ailaṃ kṣattraṃ kṣemakāntaṃ soma vaṃśavido viduḥ /
analyzed: ailam kṣattram kṣema kāntam soma vaṃśa vidaḥ viduḥ
translated: Those conversant with the solar race know the Kshatriya race of Ila to end with Kshemaka.

analyzed: ete vivasvataḥ putrāḥ kīrtitāḥ kīrtti varddhanāḥ
translated: These are the sons of Vivasvat, glorified as the enhancers of fame.

analyzed: atītāḥ vartamānāḥ ca tathā eva anāgatāḥ ca ye
translated: Those who have passed away, those who are present, and those who are yet to come,

original: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣattriyā vaiśyaḥ śūdrāścaivātra ye smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣattriyāḥ vaiśyaḥ śūdrāḥ ca eva atra ye smṛtāḥ
translated: the Brahmanas, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras who are remembered here,

analyzed: yuge yuge mahātmānaḥ samatītāḥ sahasraśas
translated: the great souls who have passed away by thousands in every age,

analyzed: bahu tvāt nāmadheyānām parisaṃkhyā kule kule
translated: because of the multitude of names, their enumeration in every family

analyzed: punarukti bahu tvāt ca na mayā parikīrttitā
translated: is not given by me, because of the repetition of names.

analyzed: vaivasvataṃtare hi asmin na nimi vaṃśaḥ samāpyate
translated: In this Vaivasvata Manvantara, the lineage of Nimi comes to an end.

original: etasyāṃ tu yugākhyāyāṃ yataḥ kṣattraṃ prapatsyate /
analyzed: etasyām tu yuga ākhyāyām yatas kṣattram prapatsyate
translated: In this period called Yuga, from which the Kshatriyas will descend,

original: tathā hi kathayiṣyāmi gadato me nibodhata // / / //
analyzed: tathā hi kathayiṣyāmi gadataḥ me nibodhata
translated: I will tell you as I speak. Listen to me.

original: devāpiḥ pauravo rājā aikṣvākuścaiva yo maruḥ /
analyzed: devāpiḥ pauravaḥ rājā aikṣvākuḥ ca eva yaḥ maruḥ
translated: King Devapi of the Puru dynasty and Marut of the Ikshvaku dynasty,

analyzed: māhāyoga bala upetau kalāpa grāmam āsthitau
translated: endowed with the power of great yoga, will reside in the village of Kalpa.

analyzed: etau kṣattra praṇetārau caturviṃśe caturyuge
translated: These two will be the founders of the Kshatriya lineage in the twenty-fourth cycle of four yugas.

analyzed: suvarcāḥ nāma putraḥ tu ikṣvākoḥ tu bhaviṣyati
translated: The son of Ikshvaku will be named Suvarcha.

analyzed: navaviṃśe yuge saḥ tha vaṃśasya ādiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the nineteenth cycle of four yugas, he will be the founder of the dynasty.

analyzed: devāpeḥ ca sa paulaḥ tu elādiḥ bhavitā nṛpaḥ
translated: King Devapi and Paulu will be the founders of the Elada dynasty.

analyzed: kṣatra pravarttakau hi etau bhaviṣyete caturyuge
translated: These two will be the founders of the Kshatriya lineage in the cycle of four yugas.

original: evaṃ sarvatra vijñeyaṃ saṃtānārthe tu latraṇam // / / //
analyzed: evam sarvatra vijñeyam saṃtāna arthe tu latraṇam
translated: Thus, the characteristics of the lineage should be known everywhere for the sake of continuity.

original: kṣīṇe kaliyuge tasminbhaviṣye ta kṛte yuge /
analyzed: kṣīṇe kali yuge tasmin bhaviṣye ta kṛte yuge
translated: When the Kali Yuga ends and the Krita Yuga begins in the future,

analyzed: saptarṣibhiḥ tu taiḥ sārddham ādye tretā yuge punar
translated: together with the seven sages, in the first Treta Yuga again,

analyzed: gotrāṇām kṣatriyāṇām ca bhaviṣyete pravarttakau
translated: they will be the founders of the lineages and Kshatriyas in the future.

analyzed: dvāpara aṃśena tiṣṭhanti kṣatriyāḥ ṛṣibhiḥ saha
translated: They remain with a portion of Dvapara, along with the Kshatriyas and the Rishis.

original: bhaviṣye tu tataḥ sarge kāle kṛtayuge punaḥ /
analyzed: bhaviṣye tu tatas sarge kāle kṛta yuge punar
translated: Then in the future creation, again in the Krita Yuga,

original: bījārthaṃ te bhaviṣyanti brahmakṣatrasya vai punaḥ // / / //
analyzed: bīja artham te bhaviṣyanti brahma kṣatrasya vai punar
translated: They will be for the sake of the seeds of the Brahmanas and Kshatriyas again.

analyzed: evam eva tu sarveṣu tiṣṭhanti iha asureṣu vai
translated: In this very way, they remain among all the Asuras.

analyzed: saptarṣayaḥ nṛpaiḥ sārddham saṃtāna artham yuge yuge
translated: The seven Rishis along with the kings, for the sake of progeny, in every Yuga.

analyzed: kṣatrasya eva samuccheda saṃbandhaḥ vai dvijaiḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The connection with the complete destruction of the Kshatriyas is remembered by the Brahmanas.

analyzed: manvantarāṇām saptānām saṃtānaḥ ca śrutaḥ ca te
translated: You have heard about the progeny of the seven Manvantaras.

analyzed: parasparāt yugānām ca brahma kṣatrasya ca udbhavaḥ
translated: The origin of the Brahmanas and Kshatriyas in the mutual Yugas,

original: yathā pravṛttisteṣāṃ vai pravṛttānāṃ tathā kṣayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: yathā pravṛttiḥ teṣām vai pravṛttānām tathā kṣayaḥ
translated: The increase of those who are engaged, and the decrease of those who are engaged,

analyzed: saptarṣayaḥ viduḥ teṣām dīrgha āyuḥ tvāt bhava abhavau
translated: The seven Rishis know their existence and non-existence due to their long life.

analyzed: etena krama yogena aila ikṣvāku anvayāḥ dvijāḥ
translated: By this sequence, the Brahmanas of the lineage of Ikshvaku,

analyzed: utpadyamānāḥ tretāyām kṣīyamāṇāḥ kalau punar
translated: Being born in Treta and decreasing in Kali,

analyzed: anuyānti yuga ākhyām tu yāvat manvantara kṣayaḥ
translated: Follow the name of the Yugas until the end of the Manvantara.

analyzed: jāmadagnyena rāmeṇa kṣatre niravaśeṣite
translated: When the Kshatriyas were completely destroyed by Rama, the son of Jamadagni,

analyzed: kṛtā iyam saṃkulā sarvā kṣatriyaiḥ vasudhādhipaiḥ
translated: This entire earth has been filled with Kshatriyas, O lord of the earth.

analyzed: dvi paṃśa kāraṇam ca eva kīrtayiṣye nibodhata
translated: I shall now describe the causes of the two-fold division. Listen.

analyzed: ailasya ikṣvāku nandasya prakṛtiḥ parivarttate
translated: The nature of Aila, the descendant of Ikshvaku, changes.

analyzed: rājānaḥ śreṇi baddhāḥ tu tathā anye kṣatriyāḥ nṛpāḥ
translated: The kings are arranged in a series, and there are other Kshatriya kings.

analyzed: ela vaṃśasya ye khyātāḥ tathā eva ikṣvākavaḥ nṛpāḥ
translated: Those who are famous in the lineage of Ila, and the kings of the Ikshvaku dynasty,

analyzed: teṣām eka śatam pūrṇam kulānām abhiṣekitam
translated: One hundred of their families have been consecrated.

original: tāvadeva tu bhojānāṃ vistaro dviguṇaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tāvat eva tu bhojānām vistaraḥ dviguṇaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The number of Bhojas is the same, but their extent is remembered as twice that.

original: bhajate tryaṃśakaṃ kṣattraṃ caturthātta dyathā diśam /
analyzed: bhajate tri aṃśakam kṣattram dyathā diśam
translated: The Kshatriyas occupy one-third, and the fourth part is distributed among the directions.

analyzed: teṣu atītāḥ samānāḥ ye bruvataḥ tān nibodhata
translated: Listen to me as I describe those who have passed away and those who are present among them.

original: śataṃ vai prativindhyānāṃ śataṃ nāgāḥ sahaihayāḥ /
analyzed: śatam vai prativindhyānām śatam nāgāḥ sa haihayāḥ
translated: There were one hundred Prativindhyas, one hundred Nagas with Ehaya,

analyzed: dhṛta rāṣṭraḥ ca ekaśatam aśītiḥ janamejayāḥ
translated: Dhritarashtra, one hundred, and eighty Janamejayas.

original: śataṃ ca brahmadattānāṃ śāriṇāṃ viriṇāṃ śatam /🔽tataḥ śataṃ tu paulānāṃ śvetakāśya kuśādayaḥ // / / //
analyzed: śatam ca brahmadattānām śāriṇām viriṇām śatam  tatas śatam tu paulānām śveta kāśya kuśa ādayaḥ
translated: One hundred Brahmadattas, one hundred Sharins, one hundred Virins,🔽Then one hundred Paulas, Shveta, Kashya, Kusa and others.

analyzed: tatas u pare sahasram vai ye tītāḥ śaśa vindavaḥ
translated: After that, there were one thousand others who have passed away, the Shashavindus.

analyzed: ījire ca aśvamedhaiḥ te sarve niyuta dakṣiṇaiḥ
translated: And all of them performed horse-sacrifices with a million as the sacrificial fee.

analyzed: evam rājarṣayaḥ sahasraśas
translated: Thus, hundreds and thousands of royal sages have passed away.

analyzed: manoḥ vaivasvatasya asmin vartamāne iṃtare tu ye
translated: In this present Manvantara of Vaivasvata Manu,

analyzed: teṣām nibodhata utpannāḥ loke saṃtatayaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: the lineages of those who have been born in the world are known.

analyzed: na śakye vistaraḥ tāsām saṃtatīnām parasparam
translated: It is not possible to describe in detail the mutual relationships of those lineages

analyzed: tad pūrva apara yogena vaktum varṣa śataiḥ api
translated: even in hundreds of years, by connecting the earlier and later ones.

analyzed: aṣṭāviṃśat yuga ākhyāḥ tu gatāḥ vaivasvata intare
translated: Twenty-eight cycles have passed in the Vaivasvata Manvantara.

analyzed: etaiḥ rājarṣibhiḥ sārddham śaṣṭāyāḥ tāḥ nibodhata
translated: Know that along with those royal sages, sixty have passed.

analyzed: catvāriṃśat trayaḥ ca eva bhaviṣyāḥ saha rājabhiḥ
translated: Forty-three will come in the future along with the kings.

analyzed: śiṣṭāḥ tu tatas vaivasvata kṣayaḥ
translated: The remaining cycles are yet to come, after which the destruction of Vaivasvata will occur.

analyzed: etat vaḥ kathitam sarve samāsa vyāsa yogataḥ
translated: This has been told to you all, in brief and in detail.

original: punaruktibahutvācca na śakya tu yugaiḥ saha /
analyzed: punarukti bahu tvāt ca na śakya tu yugaiḥ saha
translated: But due to the repetition, it is not possible to describe it along with the cycles.

original: ete yayātiputrāṇāṃ pañca vaṃśā viśāṃ hitāḥ // / / //
analyzed: ete yayāti putrāṇām pañca vaṃśāḥ viśām hitāḥ
translated: These five lineages of Yayati's sons are beneficial to the people.

analyzed: kīrttitāḥ ca vyatītāḥ ye ye lokān dhārayanti uta
translated: Those who have passed away have been mentioned, who uphold the worlds.

original: labhate ca varānpañca durlabhā niha laukikān // / / //
analyzed: labhate ca varān pañca durlabhāḥ n iha laukikān
translated: And obtains the five boons, difficult to obtain in the world.

analyzed: āyuḥ kīrttim dhanam putrān svargam ca ānantyam aśnute
translated: He enjoys longevity, fame, wealth, sons, heaven, and infinity,

analyzed: dhāraṇāt śravaṇāt ca eva pañca vaṃśasya dhīmataḥ
translated: By retaining and listening to the five lineages of the wise.

original: ityeṣa vo mayā pādastṛtīyaḥ kathito dvijāḥ /
analyzed: iti eṣa vaḥ mayā pādaḥ tṛtīyaḥ kathitaḥ dvijāḥ
translated: Thus, O Brahmins, this third section has been narrated by me to you,

analyzed: vistareṇa ānupūrvyā ca kim bhūyas varṇayāmi aham
translated: In detail and in due order. What more shall I describe?

original: iti śrībrahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyuprokte madhyamabhāge tṛtīya upoddhātapāde vaṃśānuvarṇanaṃ nāma catuḥsaptatitamo 'dhyāyaḥ // //
analyzed: iti śrī brahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyuprokte madhyama bhāge tṛtīye upoddhāta pāde vaṃśānuvarṇanam nāma catuḥsaptatitamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the seventy-fourth chapter, in the continuation of the creation, in the Brahma-vaivarta Purana, of the Narayana-kavya.

analyzed: samāptaḥ ca ayam tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ
translated: This is the end of the third section.
